fair, I got A plus.
the final accounts 70% and the quiz on MathWork is 30%.
just don't forget to check your canvas assignment from time to time.
reviews.comment_workload: light

reviews.author: RIPME
reviews.comment_content:
Function
Limit and derivatives
Differentiation
Application of differentiation
Integrals

The content gets harder each week so you need to practice a lot to understand the content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Avery's lecture is very hard to understand as he keeps saying "uh" constantly. I only attend the first lecture and I can't bear it so I didn't attend it for the rest of the course. However, the TA lecture and tutorial are super useful. My TA is Shixin Liang. She teaches each topic very clearly and her notes are neat and easy to understand,
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork 25%
Final exam 75%
Grading is considered to be very harsh as the grades are decided mainly on final exams. Final exams have only 18 questions, each question worth 1-2 points totaling 22 points. Each question worth a lot and making a careless mistake can affect your score a lot. There are about 3 hard questions in the exam and the rest is pretty easy. The final exam is divided into 6 sections each 19 minutes so you have a lot of time in the exam, therefore, you should take your time and be careful to check your answer before submitting it.
Mine:
Webwork: Full score
Final: 17/22
Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is moderate. There are about 9 Homeworks on the webwork to do throughout the course. You have unlimited attempts to do so you can easily get a full score on webwork. If you are stuck with the question, you can also join the math support centre zoom to ask questions.

reviews.author: pathetic
reviews.comment_content: The content is mostly part of M2 content, like differentiation, limits and part of integrations.
reviews.comment_teaching: I did not attend all lectures and tutorials but I do think attending tutorials helps more than attending lectures are the lecturer always just simply read out the ppt while the TA Walter Chan gives clear explanations and adequate examples are illustrated. Being able to learn the contents by yourself is important also.
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork: Full mark
Final: 15/22
Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not much comparing with many other courses. There is only webwork homework regularly and the time period assigned for doing the webwork is more than enough. Doing the questions in the tutorial notes as revision is already enough to achieve a decent result in the final exam.

reviews.author: mickyli1117
reviews.comment_content: Limit, difficeration and integration
reviews.comment_teaching:
Avery:
The professor looks like a nice guy but his lecture is quite boring and difficult for us to learn. Maybe due to online-teaching mode, all notes are hand-written. There are no tidy lecture notes which make us difficult to revise.

Speaking of his pronunciation, it doesn't really matter but he always speaks "uh.. uh.. uh.. uh.. uh.. uh.. uh.. uh.. uh.. uh.. uh.. uh.. uh". quite funny lol.

Liang, Shixin:
A very good tutor, explain the concept clearly. In her lecture and tutorial, there are math exercises which she will do during the lesson. Tidy and easy to revise.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% Homework
75% Final Exam

For the homework, it is conducted in WebWork and you can have unlimited attempts. If you are willing to spend some time on it then you can get full marks easily.

For the final exam, since there is no mid-term exam, therefore, the exam weighs very heavy to your final grade. Each question can make a huge difference in your final grade.
Actually, it is not very difficult but seems like the overall performance is normal (not good, but many are marginal pass).
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. There are total of 9 homework and on average you have at least 1 week to complete the homework.

reviews.author: Sonic12
reviews.title: Review of MATH1012
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1

Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  (1.1-1.3; Appendix A.)

Week 2

Elementary functions.  (1.5-1.6; Appendix B-D.)

Week 3

Tangent and velocity; the limit of a function and limit laws.  (2.1-2.3.)

Week 4

Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivatives and rates of change.  (2.5-2.7.)

Week 5

Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)

Week 6

Chain rule and implicit differentiation.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)

Week 7

Rates and related rates.  (3.7-3.9.)

Week 8

Maximum and minimum values.  (3.10, 4.1.)

Week 9

Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.  (4.3-4.4.)

Week 10

Curve sketching; optimization problems.  (4.5-4.7.)

Week 11

Antiderivatives; areas and distance traveled.  (4.9, 5.1.)

Week 12

Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.  (5.2-5.3.)

Week 13

substitution rule.  (5.4-5.5.)

It's just an elementary calculus topic that you might have learned in high school.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Although the topics of this course are not that difficult, professor Avery Ching's teaching is so bad that if there's someone who is first to calculus it would not be helpful to attend the main lecture.

Instead, attend tutorial classes and participate in problem-solving actively. TA is very helpful and good at teaching. Just consider the tutorial class as the main lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork with unlimited attempts. Make sure to get a full score in webwork. If you don't know how to solve a certain problem don't hesitate to google it.

The final exam consisted of 6 parts and each lasted for 20minutes. Honestly, it was way too easy compared to the released past paper of this course. Just make sure to read problems and calculate things correctly.

Webwork(25%): 100%
Final Exam(75%): 20/22

Overall Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Just do your webwork assignment when it is out.
If you are good at math or familiar with calculus it would be not much of a burden.

However, if you are not good at math or first to this topic you'll have a hard time doing homework and preparing for the final exam.

To be more specific, if you are a student who came from a country that has a very competitive math curriculum(China, India, Korea, etc.) and good at all sorts of funky math stuff in your high school, don't worry you're the king of the class.

If you have undergone some international qualifications(ib, a-level, or SAT, etc.) or came from a country that has a relatively easy math curriculum, you are quite likely to say this course is difficult.

If you do feel this course is difficult, be diligent, and practice every day. Practice makes you perfect.

reviews.comment_teaching: I only attended lectures on the first few weeks and skipped all after that. So it's not fair for me to judge her teaching. Just attend tutorials and do those exercise to make sure you know how to do the questions and understand the concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork 25%
Final exam75%
Unlimited attempts for webwork so you should be able to get full score in that part.
Do 22 mc questions in 2hrs which is divided into 6 parts, each last for 20mins.

My grade:
Webwork 100%
Final exam 17/22
Overall: A
reviews.comment_workload: There is no midterm exam for this semester. The only workload is webwork which is released every 1-2 weeks.

reviews.author: yeet420
reviews.comment_content:
I took IB SL Math and while some of the concepts I've seen before it progresses in difficulty very quickly but if you stay on top of the content and try to practice weekly it should be manageable.

- Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  
- Elementary functions.
- Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.  
- Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.  
- Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.  
- Chain rule and implicit differentiation.
- Rates and related rates.  
- Maximum and minimum values.  
- Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.  
- Curve sketching; optimization problems.  
- Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled.
- Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.  (5.2-5.3.)
- Net change; substitution rule.  (5.4-5.5.)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is kind, happy to answer students questions but her lectures are extremely boring as she just reads off the slides. Probably better off attending sessions with the TA and reviewing slides and textbooks on your own.


TA - Walter Chan
Best TA ever. 2 50 min lectures a week. Explains concepts very well and answers questions in a lot of detail. His notes and exercises are also very good practice problems to help you get familiar with the topics in this course
reviews.comment_grading:
25% Webwork online homework (unlimited tries)
75% Online MCQ final

Bad thing about not having a midterm is the first half of the course is much easier and majority of your grade ends up dependent on how well you do on the final.

Final exam was 6 canvas quizzes of 19 mins each and 3 or 4 marks. Part 1 opened at 9:30, part 2 opened at 9:50 and so on. This is a terrible system as I found the first 3 parts very easy and finished them in 8-9 mins each (with full marks) but ran out of time for the final 3 parts whereas in a normal exam you'd be able to make use of the extra time saved.

The final is also only 22 marks in total so every point is worth about 3.4% of your final grade which sucks lmao.

Overall I got:
Webwork: 100%
Final: 15/22 (Mean 13.4)

Final grade 76% and I got an A-. Seems to me the grade is fair in the end but the final being only 22 makes it very much up to chance.
reviews.comment_workload:
Overall workload is fairly light as there's no midterm (might change in future semesters) and only 10 homework assignments with about 2 weeks to do each. I'd recommend trying to find time to do a little bit of extra practice every week.

2x 1hr20min lectures a week with main professor
2x 50min lecture with TA

reviews.author: HinsonYip
reviews.title: Finally
reviews.comment_content:
Huge amount of M2 content has to be familiarized within few months. If you do not have previous learning about calculus, you may need to depend more on yourself. Actually, it is quite time-consuming for the beginner to make clear the complicated concepts and apply them into the final exam.


Week 1
Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  (1.1-1.3; Appendix A.)

Week 2
Elementary functions.  (1.5-1.6; Appendix B-D.)

Week 3
Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.  (2.1-2.3.)

Week 4
Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.  (2.5-2.7.)

Week 5
Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)

Week 6
Chain rule and implicit differentiation.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)

Week 10

Week 11

Week 12

Week 13

reviews.comment_teaching:
For Zhang, her teaching style is quite mediocre and boring. But she should be much better than Avery Ching. Her powerpoint slides can help me make clear the theorem of different M2 concepts. She can also give me an immediate email reply with clear answer when I have some problems about exam preparation. Her performance may thus be moderate.

For Walter Chan, I just want to say a big thank to him. His note, tone and teaching style can basically eliminate most of my misunderstanding of those complicated content. His notes also highly focus on practical side, which provide many chances for effective practice. If you just study and revise those notes, getting B+ is possible.
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork 25%
Final Exam (online mc) 75%

Those 25% should be taken easily as long as you are willing to spend time into webwork by chegg, your friends, other online resourses, or just your own calculations. The unlimited attempt mechanism does really help me a lot, especially in the situation of getting a ungood exam result.

For the online exam, the difficulty is a bit lower as it is a open book exam. However, some of the questions were still quite demanding for student ability. So, don't think that it was too easy.
reviews.comment_workload: As I said before, this course is crazy for the Calculus beginner. The only way to escape from the fate of fail is practice. Only practice can make you know that you really understand the concepts. For webwork, its workload just depends on your way to get rid of them. Although hardworking may not help you get A grade, at least it can prevent the re-take of this course. Believe me, you don't want to face Avery possibly again.

Final mean was 7/15

I did my final online (fall 2019 review!)

got B in the end

webwork
just get someone to do it for you
some questions are quite annoying
Google is your best friend

reviews.author: thanos

limits
single variable differentiation

reviews.author: gracechan2000
reviews.title: Boring course
reviews.comment_content:
This is an introductory course in one-variable calculus, the first in the Calculus I and II sequence, designed for students that have not taken HKDSE Mathematics Extended Module M1 or M2. Topics include functions and their limits, continuity, derivatives and rules of differentiation, applications of derivatives, and basic integral calculus.

Topics:
Functions
Limits and Continuity
Derivatives
Applications of Derivatives
Integration
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring.
Didn't allow students to use their phones during class.
No attendance for both lectures and tutorials.
I almost skipped all lessons.
The tutorials were quite useful though.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assessment15% by homework
30% by midterm exam
55% by final exam
Bad grading. The midterm is quite easy but the final is really difficult.
The use of calculators was prohibited in the exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork. The luckiest thing is that you can have unlimited attempts to try to get a higher mark.

reviews.author: LemonLemon
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  
Week 2 Elementary functions
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.  
Week 6 Chain rule and implicit differentiation.
Week 7 Rates and related rates.
Week 8 Linear approximation and differentials; Maximum and minimum values.
Week 9 Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.  
Week 10 Curve sketching; optimization problems
Week 11 Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled
Week 12 Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.  
Week 13 Net change; substitution rule

Basic Concept for Calculus; Not really too difficult but need to put some effort on understanding those concept
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kinda boring teaching and it seems to be not necessary to attend the lecture for you to understand the content.
You just need practice on your own.
reviews.comment_grading:
Special arrangement for this semester due to the protest in Hong Kong.
There are 2 grading scheme:
1) 15% webwork, 30% Mid-term, 55% Exam
2) 15% webwork, 85% Exam
Only count the scheme that obtain the highest mark

Overall is 94.4 and I got A grade.
Calculator is prohibited in both mid-term and exam, but you can still handle it easily.
reviews.comment_workload:
Doing webwork is not the biggest workload but you need to do more practice if you really want to have good grade.
(You may need to memorise some of the equation for the exam.)

reviews.author: I want to sleep
reviews.title: Not difficult, but you have to put your effort
reviews.comment_content:
Basic calculus stuff. I think that is not really difficult. Even if you fk up, there are many tutorials that can be found on youtube, and the content is nearly the same.

I think no reason you cannot understand to content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Avery Ching's teaching is fking boring. If you pay attention, you will find that he always say "errrr".

He will try write down "notes" on paper, and you need to copy it.
But later on you will find actually is the same as online lecture note. But the process of copying his note will help you to memorize the content. And his note is more easier to understand then the online one.

About tutorial:
I attended two tutor's classes, the teaching is total different.

Phyllis website: https://masxliang.people.ust.hk/

Phyllis is trying to teach question which is from MATH1013, and I think her teaching is not good (lack of explanation, etc)

Another one is Walter Chan <= he is better
https://sites.google.com/view/walterchan

his notes contain lots of examples questions, he will solve the question step by step (easy to follow), clear explanation also.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are two grading scheme:
1. 0.15 for hw, 0.3 for mt and 0.55 for final
2. 0.15 for hw and 0.85 for final

I got:
100% for HW
42 / 50 for mt
12 / 15 for final

my overall score is 88% and I got A-.

The tip of getting good grade is to practise and practise,
make sure you understand to concept even you can just recite formula. If you have time, try those questions from MATH1013.
reviews.comment_workload: reasonable workload, you just need to do my hw on webwork, and not much.

reviews.author: 其實我無讀MATH1012
reviews.title: fml
reviews.comment_content: The content is very easy. You can handle it easily. It includes some basic concepts of calculus, which are really easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: Speechless. He teaches very bad. The worst professor ever. He speaks very bad English, with a very strong accent. It is very hard for us to understand the concepts during the lessons. Luckily, I have got a not bad tutor.
reviews.comment_grading: You will never know why you have got a sh*t grade. Even you know how to do every question in your exam and midterm.
reviews.comment_workload: Very less. Only need to do webwork. The questions are very easy.

reviews.author: Mark144
reviews.title: Hard course
reviews.comment_content: Content is pretty challenging especially if you don't have any calculus background. It is challenging even if you took IB SL maths because it's not the same type of calculus you learnt. There's intro to limits and differentiation and a little bit of integration.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is pretty decent, he makes sure that no one is on their phones and enforces the fact that if you aren't paying attention you shouldn't be there. He speaks loudly with pretty good English and his hand writing is always very big. There are always video lectures of his lessons which are somewhat useless as it never focuses on the board.
reviews.comment_grading: Trash grade course, so many people failed. The mid term and finals were really hard, even though I think it's a curved grade, it's difficult to achieve a high grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much, but it is difficult to study for mid terms and finals. Webworks you can just find the answers on ESU sources or any other math source. Use those and try to figure out the solution

reviews.author: maria.13
reviews.title: Lousy course for non-calculus background
reviews.comment_content:
The material is equivalent to the calculus in IB Math SL + HL + HL Calculus Option combined, so if a student has never seen calculus before, it will be quite difficult to keep up with the course.
The content seems very uncoordinated across the lecture, tutorial, homework, and exams. The lecture and tutorial go over the same content at different times which makes it highly confusing. Furthermore, the questions in the tutorial, homework, and exams are different in type and difficulty level making it hard to deduce the exam content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Absolutely terrible. The lectures are boring and hard to follow (you can see the diminishing number of students attending the lectures over the weeks). The professor spends more time going over confusing proofs rather than explaining the content.
The tutorial isn't any better. Although the tutorial goes over more of the practice question, their difficult level is no where near the difficultly of the exam questions.
I found IB textbooks more useful than any of the lectures or tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework: 15%
Midterm: 35%
Final: 50%
The curve surprisingly saved me. My midterm grade was much better than my final grade, although still not satisfactory. The problem is, is that the grader may not grant you points if your methodology does not match the one in the mark scheme, which can significantly impact your overall score.
reviews.comment_workload: If you have a calculus background, at first it will seem like there's nothing much to do, but the content gradually gets more difficult so you will probably have to study more towards the end of the course. The homework does not take too long, although some questions can be quite puzzling (make sure to do all the homework as it is counted in your final grade). However, if you do not have a calculus background, you will probably have a lot of studying and catching up to do.

reviews.author: Sola
reviews.comment_content:
Function
Differentiation
Integration
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecture is about the theory, proof of differentiation and integration. For the exam, you only know how to do the questions so many people skipped the lecture.

For the tutorial, I think is very useful as the tutors will only talk about the questions and do it with you.

Therefore, I would say you can skip the lecture but you should not skip the tutorial classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
15% Homework, 30% Midterm Exam, 55% Final Exam
HW: It is easy for you to get full marks for webwork as you can attempt for unlimited times.

Midterm: Not hard, the mean was  about 26/50, my score was 43/50

Final: Hard for students who have never studied M1 or M2, I am ok in differentiation but bad at integration. Therefore, I got 26/60, the mean was about 21/60.

At last, I got a B so I would say the grading is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: There are only 10 sets of webwork exercise.

reviews.author: JasonFung123

Furthermore, the professor is full of passion, if you had any ambiguous concept,you can feel free to ask him.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is that what capacity you have, you are worth to get a good grade. For me, I am not a radical in maths and I just want to accomplish the common core requirements, therefore I haven't studied very hard, finally got C.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite low.You only had to finish one to two webwork per week and attend midterm and final exam is adequate.

reviews.author: KelPan

reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  (1.2-1.3; Appendix A.)
Week 2 Elementary functions.  (1.5-1.6; Appendix B-D.)
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.  (2.1-2.3.)
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.  (2.5-2.7.)
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)

Week 7 Rates and related rates.  (3.7-3.9.)
Week 8 Maximum and minimum values.  (3.10, 4.1.)
Week 9 Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.  (4.3-4.4.)
Week 10 Curve sketching; optimization problems.  (4.5-4.7.)
Week 11 Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled.  (4.9, 5.1.)
Week 12 Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.  (5.2-5.3.)
Week 13 Net change; substitution rule.  (5.4-5.5.)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Totally suck --> AV Ching
Lectures, Tutorials and exams are totally different, you can never do better only for doing the exercise they gave you.
reviews.comment_grading:
WeBWorK Online Homework: 15% (Mean is 89%)
Midterm Exam : 30% (Mean is 30/50)

reviews.comment_workload: Webwork every week, but Google大神 can always help. You have to do it, it worth 15% which help you pass.

reviews.author: drrusti
reviews.title: Bearable
reviews.comment_content:
The content of this course includes the first five chapters of James Stewart's 'Calculus Early Transcendentals, 7th Edition' which is comprised of the following:

Chapter 1: Functions and Models
Chapter 2: Limits and Derivatives
Chapter 3: Differentiation Rules
Chapter 4: Applications of Differentiation
Chapter 5: Integrals

As an IB SL Math student it was rather challenging to learn some of the theory presented. However, even with only an SL math understanding, the concepts of this course can definitely be tackled with hard work and study of the textbook.

Yet even if you do this, the questions on the exams are much harder than most you would have practised. To add onto that, Professor Avery likes to trick his students. It seems that the only way to get A+ is to work from day 1 and truly have a clear understanding of the content.  

I STRONGLY SUGGEST FINDING THE TEXTBOOK FOR SELF-STUDY
reviews.comment_teaching:
Avery's teaching is pretty tough to keep up with. It is very hard to actually learn from his lectures as he skips a lot of steps, making it very confusing for people who aren't well versed in maths.

The most redeeming part of the teaching component in this course is the tutorials. I had Ms. Phyllis Liang as my tutor and she was more than happy to help. Otherwise, I found myself visiting the MSC a lot.
reviews.comment_grading:
9 Homeworks — 100%
Absolute Grading
Midterm — 86%
Final — 53%
Total — 70.13% B+

I think it's fair
reviews.comment_workload:
9 Homeworks
Midterm
Final

The workload in this course will be heavy if you are M1 or SL math

1 Number, inequalities and absolutes (Appendix A), basic functions and graphs,

trigonometric functions (3.3)
6 Chain rule (3.4), implicit differentiation, derivatives of inverse trigonometric
functions and logarithmic functions (3.5, 3.6)
7 Rates of change problems (3.7, 3.8), related rates (3.9)
8 Maximum and minimum values (4.1)
9 Derivatives and graphs (4.3), L’Hôpital’s rule (4.4)

11 Antiderivatives (4.9), areas (5.1)

reviews.comment_teaching:
Frankly, his teaching is good, i can see that he pay so many efforts to teach well in this course and try his best to let all the student understand.

It may be the best teaching teachers in the Math 1012 Course.

reviews.comment_workload: The webwork exercises was time-consuming. I highly recommend you to ask somebody for help.

reviews.author: shaolinmonk
reviews.title: An Adventure into the mind of Avery Ching
reviews.comment_content: I feel the content packs a lot into 1 semester. Limits, differentiation and integration taught from 0. I feel for those which do not have a math background like me.
reviews.comment_teaching: It goes without saying that Avery Ching is very passionate about maths, however, I feel he is a very difficult instructor. His Uhhhh and So, what next have become memes. He also writes a lot of redundant notes which ends up becoming quite useless when studying. Be prepared to fall asleep more than once during his lectures. However, he has been kind enough to offer 5-minute breaks and occasionally lets us leave early. He is also very open to answering any questions you have.
reviews.comment_grading: Math grading is known to be unforgiving. Full marks for homework, way above mean for both midterm and final. Got a B.
reviews.comment_workload: Be prepared to devote hours per day trying the infamous webwork. It is not entirely difficult, but the most difficult questions could take 2 hours per question. I felt I was entirely self-studying this course. I had to study for close to 100 hours for both midterm and final.

reviews.author: MaxH
reviews.title: Good course to equip you with fundamental calculus knowledge
reviews.comment_content:
Easy calculus(differentiation and integration) and not so difficult.
1 Number, inequalities and absolutes (Appendix A), basic functions and graphs,
composite functions (1.1, 1.2, 1.3)
2 Exponential functions (1.5), trigonometric functions (Appendix D), inverse functions,
logarithmic functions, inverse trigonometric functions (1.6)
3 Tangent and velocity (2.1), the limit of a function, limit laws (2.2, 2.3)
4 Continuity (2.5), limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes (2.6), derivatives and
rates of change (2.7)
5 Basic derivatives (2.8, 3.1), product and quotient rules (3.2), derivatives of
trigonometric functions (3.3)
6 Chain rule (3.4), implicit differentiation, derivatives of inverse trigonometric
functions and logarithmic functions (3.5, 3.6)
7 Rates of change problems (3.7, 3.8), related rates (3.9)
8 Maximum and minimum values (4.1)
9 Derivatives and graphs (4.3), L’Hôpital’s rule (4.4)
10 Curve sketching (4.5, 4.6), optimization problems (4.7)

reviews.comment_teaching: Normal, I think it is more or less the same. Professors just keep proofing formula during the lessons and work a few examples. You can skip the lectures and just attend the tutorials since TA would teach you how to solve the problems effectively and much more useful
reviews.comment_grading:
15% by homework and classwork
30% by midterm exam
55% by final exam
class mean for midterm is 28/50, final mean is 25/60
I get 47/50 in midterm and 54/60 in final . Overall:91/100
Finally, i get an A+ Grade. Put some effort and you can easily get A range
reviews.comment_workload: acceptable, around 10 homework in webwork and around 1 per week, one midterm and one final exam.

reviews.author: goat123
reviews.comment_content:

Week 2 Elementary functions.  
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.  
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.

reviews.comment_teaching: Lectures tend to focus on theories as opposed to solving questions. I suggest attending all tutorial lessons as they provide useful resources and teach you how to answer exam style questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was reasonable. If you manage to complete all the Webworks you should be able to pass. Study well for the midterm as it was easier to score in this exam compared to the final.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is pretty much optional with exception to the compulsory webwork assignments which are provided every week via Webwork. I suggest going to the maths support centre if you don't know how to answer certain questions. If you want a good grade I suggest that you complete all the tutorial resources provided to you.

reviews.author: halo123
reviews.comment_content:
This course is for those who didn't take M1 or M2 in secondary school.
Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  
Week 2 Elementary functions.  
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.  
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.
Week 6 Chain rule and implicit differentiation.
Week 7 Rates and related rates.  
Week 8 Mean Value Theorem. Maximum and minimum values.
Week 9 Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.  
Week 10 Curve sketching; optimization problems.  
Week 11 Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled.  
Week 12 Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
Week 13 Net change; substitution rule.
The course requires student to learn a tons of content in such a short period of time. You have to learn 3 years with of use math in 3 months. Hell for non-math lovers. Worst course in the semester. I enjoyed nothing in the course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In lectures, lecturer prove math theory instead of teaching you how to apply the stuffs you have learnt so it's kind of useless if you are not interested in math. In tutorial the tutors would teach you different math problems so be sure to attend the tutorials.
However, it is really hard to understand the content .
reviews.comment_grading: There's a huge gap between the lesson materials and exams. The questions in exams are way more difficult than the questions in tutorials/webwork.
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork every week. You have to lots of exercise and still cannot solve the problems in the exam.

reviews.author: 排骨
reviews.title: I don't like this
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Calculus
Yes, the things they teach are basic enough, but as always the exams are set ridiculously hard. What do you even expect from a math course?
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor has heart I guess, but his accent really is unintelligible, so can't understand anything. I only attended 3 lectures total, but you may as well skip them since you can't understand anything anyways. The tutorials on the other hand are useful, make good use of them.
reviews.comment_grading: Curve grading, nothing much to say. Got 70% overall (1 SD above mean) and got a B for your reference
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork. Thats all. Wolfram Alpha and Symbolab will help you immensly

reviews.author: Jasa
reviews.title: Bad teacher but good grade
reviews.comment_content:

reviews.comment_teaching:
I give a C, which is A for tutorial, E for lecture.

I only attend tutorial, Phyllips, who is very very  good at teaching.

For word, his real teaching and trash is 1:1. He spoke many trash and Errr, Arrrrr all the time, which is confusing.
reviews.comment_grading:
Best grading. Not absolute grading but curve grading.

Midterm: 80/100
Final: 87/100
Overall 87 --> A

It is easy to get A as there are many newbies in this class. And 87 should be a A- in 1013 with absolute grading.

The paper is fair. Most MC are same with 1013 as I checked with my frd, but long Qs are a lot easier.

Easy Webwork.

In case if u find it difficult, just find your 1013 frd, the questions are exact7ly the same.

reviews.author: lhtam
reviews.title: Require much effort to pass this course
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  (1.2-1.3; Appendix A.)
Week 2 Elementary functions.  (1.5-1.6; Appendix B-D.)
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.  (2.1-2.3.)
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.  (2.5-2.7.)
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)
Week 6 Chain rule and implicit differentiation.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)
Week 7 Rates and related rates.  (3.7-3.9.)
Week 8 Maximum and minimum values.  (3.10, 4.1.)
Week 9 Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.  (4.3-4.4.)
Week 10 Curve sketching; optimization problems.  (4.5-4.7.)
Week 11 Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled.  (4.9, 5.1.)
Week 12 Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.  (5.2-5.3.)
Week 13 Net change; substitution rule.  (5.4-5.5.)

Content is tough for ppl who did not study M1/2 before. Expected that you can't catch up after the differentiation part as they rushed over the application of differentiation and integration part due to tight teaching schedule.
reviews.comment_teaching:
There are two 1.5 hrs lecture per week held by Dr. Wei, mainly focus on proofing the theory, which I found useless in order to pass the exams. Yet his teaching is way better than Avery, his accent is acceptable.

However, the big tutorial (50mins) and small tutorial (50mins) held by Kenneth Ng (TA) per week are very useful as he mainly focus on how to solve the problem. He will explain everything clearly and definitely feel his passion in teaching! Quite unfortunate that he resigned this semester as he applied research position :(

All in all, you could skip all the lectures but attending tutorial is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
reviews.comment_grading:
WebWork (9 homework in total) 15%
Mid-term Exam (1hr 30mins) 30%
Final Exam (3hrs) 55%

Try to complete ALL homework, it saves you to pass this course.
Mid-term is relatively easy this year but the final blown my mind which I cant even calculate one question.

So here's my result:
WebWork (15%) - 15/15, above mean
Mid-term Exam (30%), mean ~27/50, got 24/50, below mean
Final Exam (55%), mean ~22/60, got 24/60, above mean
Overall: 51.4%, got C+

As long as you have 30% you will pass this course.
reviews.comment_workload: I'm a retaker of this course which I failed in 17/18 Fall semester. I failed last year because I can't catch up the content and the TA cant help as they are not really patient and teach well. So I spent the whole summer to understand and drilling the course content (so actually I spent 6 months to prep this course!). You definitely need others help because lecturer and TA are not enough. For ppl who take this course for the first time, you better pay extra effort. For maths noob (like me), you will know the pain :(

reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.

Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.  
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.

Week 13 Net change; substitution rule.

Mid-term exam will be mainly about things be taught from Week 1 to Week 5.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring teaching.
Teaching theories but not calculations.

Don't choose his section if you have choice or you will regret.

You could just skip the lessons and work on the problems yourself at home, just go to MSC to ask for help when you need some. Attending lectures for this course is completely useless and time wasting.
reviews.comment_grading:
15% Webwork
35% Mid-term exam
50% Final exam

Difficult to get good grade if you didn't have any calculus background like me.
Easy to get good grade if you do.

If you get an F, unfortunately, don't hesitate to retake during winter semester, although the workload will be much higher ( 3 lectures per week and 4 hours each, much easier to get a better grade)
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy, it's a 4 cred course after all, around 1 webwork per week.

But if you are only trying to complete the things and get the 15%, just seek for help from yahoo answers / symbolab, would only take you less than 1 hour for each webwork.

reviews.author: System
reviews.comment_content: 讀既內容基本上同MATH1013一樣，存在呢個course只不過為了分開有延伸數學同無既人，比多一個sem你catch up有M2既人，然後大家就會入MATH1014。讀既內容絕大部分都係M2內容，Lecture同Tutorial既內容經常會重複，可以只去其中一個。
reviews.comment_teaching: 教學ok。上堂基本上系講theory為主，有d重要既theory會prove比你睇，不過絕大半部分都係抄textbook既重點出來，睇翻textbook有時候仲清楚
reviews.comment_grading: Grading一般般。Midterm同final高過mean接近一個sd都係得B-。不過個grading系拉curve
reviews.comment_workload: workload 可以接受，只需要做webwork，無限嘗試唔會扣分。再加上一個midterm同final。

reviews.author: Xman
reviews.comment_content: This is an introductory course in one-variable calculus, the first in the Calculus I and II sequence, designed for students that have not taken HKDSE Mathematics Extended Module M1 or M2. Topics include functions and their limits, continuity, derivatives and rules of differentiation, applications of derivatives, and basic integral calculus.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Avery講野口音好重，成日會ererer，會聽到好唔舒服，就好似睇戲睇到一半令你出戲咁。
佢教既內容主要都係prove返d theory，如果只為exam可以唔洗去上。
IS THE WORST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm 30/50
exam 58/100
webwork 15/15
overall b-
唔算好grade
reviews.comment_workload: 平時得webwork要做，都係用symbolab同wolfram做。

reviews.author: Jacky 01
reviews.title: math 1012 review
reviews.comment_content: 3個月cover曬中學差唔多2年既野，而且前面中要教function教成個月，真正教limit, integration, derivatives得果2個月，根本唔夠時間消化，搞到我要補習。中要比一堆有讀m2 drop左既人屈機。簡單來講，你有讀m2會笑，冇讀會易爛grade。你要好似溫dse甘勤力先可以追到。而且的homework中要同1013系一模一樣，只不過系數字唔同，真系會唔識做，要搵1013既人教。
reviews.comment_teaching: lecture得講一的最基本既野，但考試又根本唔系出同一個level既題目。tutorial雖然好的，但時間太短，搞到根本講唔切，甚至3分鐘講一課都試過。
reviews.comment_grading: OK grade。你有個37%已經有C-。要注意homework已經15%，mid-term 30%, final 55%。如果你冇信心考試pass，homework一定要搵識既同學教你做曬。
reviews.comment_workload: homework數量同1013一樣，但每份功課中間間隔長的，大概3個星期有2份功課，連study break都有。不過的homework都幾難，但技術冇同學教都有辦法，可以將題目完全copy and paste去Yahoo，你會搵到幾乎一樣既問題，只不過數據唔同，下面的解答你只需代唔同數字落去，甘都有助於你去了解點做。功課可以試無限次。

reviews.author: nightkirin
reviews.comment_content: four main topic function, limit, depreciation and basic integration. it's very basic if you have study M2 before in hkdse . basically, you already finished 90% of the syllabus.However, if you haven't, This is a really hard time for us
reviews.comment_teaching: avery is a poor speaker he just copies his notes to you and read aloud which the notes can be found on his website after the lesson but without examples he mentions during the lecture.    frankly speaking, you can just skip all the lecture if you don't understand, because most people neither. Don't waste your time, try study by your own or go to math center. definitely usefuler than sitting in the lecture hall coping notes .however, if you want to pass you must !!!!!!!!! go to the tutorial ,it's more practical and  tutors may also give you some very very useful tips for the exam . Strongly recommend you tofinish all the question they gave you to practise. at least you will know what midterm and final look like.
reviews.comment_grading:
only homework midterm and final will be counted
the mean of the course are very low mostly below 50% so is sd because most people in 1012 aren't good at math so it's not hard to get b range if you score above mean (heard from the others, i don't have Brange......................)
reviews.comment_workload: there aren't any assignment or quiz but every week you have to finish an online homework through the website webwork. about 10-12 question each week. it's not very hard you should be able to handle if you attend the tutorial, you have unlimited chance to submit your answers untill correct. if you just don't give a shit you can just copy others.   (that's what most people do but I don't have friends...........)

reviews.author: Andyks
reviews.comment_content:
Just some introduction to calculus. Easy to handle if you are willing to spend time after lessons.

Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  
Week 2 Elementary functions.  
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of a function and limit laws.
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.  
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.
Week 6 Chain rule and implicit differentiation.
Week 7 Rates and related rates.  
Week 8 Mean Value Theorem. Maximum and minimum values.
Week 9 Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.  
Week 10 Curve sketching; optimization problems.  
Week 11 Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled.  
Week 12 Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
Week 13 Net change; substitution rule.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Avery's lesson will make you sleep and you will copy a lot of concepts and definitions which are not too useful in your exams. There are little examples which will help you understand the concepts and applications but still not too useful.

Zeta's tutorial will focus on more useful applications of the theories in exams and there will be a thick practice. It is suggested to complete much of the practice if you have not learn calculus before or you are not so familiar with the concepts. It is really useful.

Because of the length of the course, Avery and Zeta will have to rush through the contents, there will be little time for you to do exercise. To catch up, you will have to spend much time doing Zeta's exercise at home.

It is suggested to take Zeta's notes even though you are not enrolled in Zeta's tutorial.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term: 23/50 (mean 21.53/50)
Final: 70/100 (mean 44.69/100)
Webwork full mark
Overall get a B+ which is satisfying for the mark in mid term
reviews.comment_workload:
Remeber to study hard for mid term as the mean for mid term is usually low.
if you have not learnt calculus before and you want to get a good grade, please study hard. It takes a lot of time.
Zeta's tutorial session is useful, suggested to attend even if you are not enrolled in his session

reviews.author: dlwlrma
reviews.comment_content:
too difficult for the one who approach calculus for the first time
mainly focus on differentiation , integration , and the graphing
the time allocation is badly planned, the most difficult part use the least time to teach
reviews.comment_teaching: the teaching is extremely bad, just teach us theory and its proof, does not teach us how to apply the theory and how to use the theory practically
reviews.comment_grading: the grading is extremely bad, I know many people who got a D or even F in this course
reviews.comment_workload: with webwork every week, no quiz, a mid term exam ,and a final exam

reviews.author: fongjj
reviews.title: Good Grade if you worked hard
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  
Week 2 Elementary functions.  
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.  
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.
Week 6 Chain rule and implicit differentiation.
Week 7 Rates and related rates.  
Week 8 Mean Value Theorem. Maximum and minimum values.
Week 9 Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.  
Week 10 Curve sketching; optimization problems.  
Week 11 Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled.  
Week 12 Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
Week 13 Net change; substitution rule.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Ching 既堂一定要上，因為佢係無notes只係上堂個陣會手抄notes比你。上堂會教concepts，佢會prove比啲formula 同埋解釋concepts比你聽，你需要理解啲formula點黎同記住佢上堂有提過既tricks，因為考試會考番。

Zeta 既Tutorial唔係太岩我，因為佢講野比較悶同無聲氣，好難catch到佢既重點，所以到後期都差唔多走哂佢啲堂，而且上Canvas有番哂所以tutorial 既videos，上網睇可以pause同play比較易吸收。Tutorial都要上，但我建議你就番走左堂都要上番canvas睇片就得。而且，你都可以去sit其他tutor既堂，不過我就無試過喇。
reviews.comment_grading:
Background: No background on M1/M2
Web Work (Webwork 1-9) : 15% (15/15)
Mid-term: 30% (38/50)
Final Exam : 55% ( 78/100)
Overall % : ~81%
Overall Grading : A
reviews.comment_workload:
對於無讀過m1/m2既同學會有啲吃力，一開頭上手會有啲難，但明左就無問題，最緊要就係做哂所有web-work，會快啲明白同運用到啲concept。

總括而言，自己都用左幾多時間落去呢一科到，一黎自己無底，都係靠做Zeta份練習，Web-work，同睇Khan Academy啲片去學。開頭上手幾辛苦，但過左mid-term後啲concept同應用都相對地容易啲，所以無m1/m2底同學都唔洗驚，呢科係努力就會回報既一科。

reviews.author: eatingfreak
reviews.comment_content:
DSE M2 stuff
Avery does the proving and Zeta does Maths questions with you
reviews.comment_teaching:
Avery proved the equations or concepts, which turned out to be quite boring to students who do not have a great interest in mathematics so I skipped his lectures later on. And he spoke quite slow and in Hong Kong-ish English.
Zeta, on the other hand, taught really fast and precise, sometimes a bit too fast that it was not easy to follow. The good thing is that he uploaded his class videos a day or two after so you can watch it again to make yourself understand better. You can benefit quite a lot as long as you really finish exercises he assigned and try your best to follow.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean is quite low, I guess that's because many of us didn't have M2 in our high school but I still got a bad grade haha
reviews.comment_workload: webwork has to be done usually weekly or biweekly

reviews.author: Edenyt
reviews.title: ok
reviews.comment_content:
mostly like  M2 in DSE
content is 90% the same with math 1013
mainly learn the limit, differentiation, derivative
reviews.comment_teaching:
his teaching is very boring for me, mainly explain the math concept, very difficult to understand, almost skip all the lecture as his lecture is always at 9 am and will fall asleep easily
the tutorial is more helpful for me and i attend the most tutorial, will teach how to do exercise
reviews.comment_grading:
have the midterm, final and webwork
mean is about C
need work super hard to have a good grade unless u have dropped M2 before
reviews.comment_workload: ok, with around 10webwork assignment for the whole term, don't have any extra assignment

reviews.author: asdfg
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 - Functions and graphs, exponential functions, transformations of graphs
Week 2 - Logarithmic functions, trigonometric functions
Week 3 - Trigonometric identities, concept of a limit
Week 4 - One-sided limits, infinite limits and limits at infinity
Week 5 - Continuity, concept of a derivative
Week 6 - Differentiation rules
Week 7 - Chain rule, implicit differentiation
Week 8 - Higher derivatives, rate and related rates
Week 9 - Minimum and maximum
Week 10 - Optimization, L'Hopital Rule
Week 11 - Anti-derivatives, indefinite integrals
Week 12 - Definite integrals, Fundamental Theorem of Calculus (FTC)
Week 13 - Substitution method
reviews.comment_teaching: If you have any questions, you could feel free to ask the professor. He is really nice and able to explain it quite detailed. However, the TA does not have such patience. If you don't understand after her explanation, don't ask her again. Try to ask the professor.
reviews.comment_grading:
Even you have studied hard, you may not get a good grade. Most of the people could not answer the questions that the professor asked.

Someone with M2 bases will feel that it is quite easy for them and they may able to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only have about 3-4 online questions per week in canvas
Attendance will be taken once a week.

reviews.author: 皮斯卡
reviews.comment_content: a lot of topics are required to study
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching of avery is boring and theoretical. Since mid-September  , I skipped all the lecture by Avery and only attended the tutorial. Zeta's teaching is focus on examination skills so will be more useful of the people that are weak at Maths
reviews.comment_grading:
78.x% get A-
Most of the webwork answer can be got from the internet or online calculator. Finish all webwork can add few percent of final grade so it is recommended to do ( If  u dont know u can ask ur friends so no difficulty at all )
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is ok. Webwork is the only homework and u can choose not to do it. If u do more exercise in zeta's notes u will have better result in the examination.

reviews.author: dondondon
reviews.title: Worst course ever
reviews.comment_content: As its course name, mainly cover calculus stuffs like limits, derivatives and integration. As a course designed for students who have not studied calculus during secondary education, it is really hard to catch up with the content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very, very bad. Avery only focus on concepts but dont really teach how to solve the questions. Kitty, the TA,  also teaches poorly. In her tutorials, she often calculate the questions wrongly herself and only usually only about 10 students attend her tutorials. On the other hand, Zeta, who will teach one lecture session, do demonstrate how to solve different kinds of problems and in a relatively good way. He also prepared a set of exercises for us and if you do all questions in it, it should be able to help you understand more.
reviews.comment_grading:
A few sets of webwork, one mid-term and final exam.

No attendance will be taken in lectures and tutorials.

Bad. But it is probably because of how hard the content is for non-maths lovers. Mean for the final exam is just about 3x%.
reviews.comment_workload: Although compulsory workload for the courses is not much, approximately one webwork per 1-2 weeks consisting of at most 15 questions, you really need to spend a lot of time after lessons to practice doing the questions.

reviews.author: qwerty
reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.comment_content:
Pre calculus (identities, arcsin, arccos, arctan etc)
Binomial thm (optional but very useful in In)
Limit
Asymptotes, horizontal and vertical
Squeeze thm
Mean value thm
Differentiation
Chain rule
Optimization
Graphing
Extrema
Tangent lines
Summation
Integration
Substitution rule
Riemann sum (right left and mdpt)
Fundamental thm of calculus
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kitty is an inadequate tutorial instructor. All she does is mutter and write out the answers for the exercises without explaining adequately. Her tutorial is useless. And when u ask her questions, she justs give short, abrupt  answers with no elaboration. Simply put, she's a good mathematician, but by no means an adequate instructor
Many ppl dont like the instructor, Avery but he's actually very good. His explanations can be long winded but the details in his steps are very important. If u understand those details, the webwork will be very easy. Helpful instructor, will answer any questions u may hv. His exam questions are quite tricky. Some are taken out of webwork.
IA Zeta Chan(not found in instructor column) is the best. Explains very clearly. Best presentation and the most prepared. Also since his sessions are recorded, it is easy to catch up. His lectures revise Avery's main pts so all the essentials are there.
reviews.comment_grading: If u complete all the webwork and get 1sd above mean for final and midterm, u can get into a range.
reviews.comment_workload:
Webwork x10 (must hand in, grade saver)
Midterm x1 (8ish mcq, 7ish written, not too bad this one)
Final x1 (tricky)
Zeta's lecture notes (need not hand in, but very useful if u wanna take a practice run.)

reviews.author: horacehoho
reviews.comment_content:
依個course教嘅嘢同DSE M2差唔多，有三角比同Summation等等嘅Topic，但係最主要都係集中喺Limit、Differential同埋Integration上面。

中學冇讀過M2同埋non-jupas升上嚟嘅人可能會覺得吃力少少，不過如果有做齊webwork同埋有自己練數嘅話應該都可以pass到。
reviews.comment_teaching:
上Avery Ching嘅Lecture只係同佢一齊炒notes，所以其實上佢堂嘅作用唔大。

反而上Zeta嘅Lecture同埋Tutor係會教你點做數會比較有用，亦會教一啲concept，有咩問題嘅話佢都會幫你。

只不過如果你唔識做又唔問佢嘅話會喺堂上面話你。
reviews.comment_grading:
考試同埋Mid-term嘅題目可能會刁鑽一啲，主要睇你點應用課堂上面學過嘅嘢，而唔係平時做開嘅數。

我本身數學底子唔太好，所以最後得C-，但係其實係我自己嘅問題，所以如果肯花時間做下數嘅話成績應該唔會太差。
reviews.comment_workload: Workload唔大，只係需要大約每兩個禮拜上網做一次webwork就得喇。

reviews.author: shirayuki653
reviews.comment_content:
都幾多野下
Local:
Dse M2: Radian measure,Graph transformation,Absolute value,Differentiation rules,Rate of change,Indefinite integral,Definite integral

HKAL Pure Maths: L’Hospital rule, Mean Value Theorem, Bijective, Inverse Function, Differentiation of inverse trig function, Continuity and Differentiability, Fundamental theorem of calculus

New topics: Optimization, Riemann sum


For non-locals, the syllabus is similar to AP Calculus AB and IB Maths, you may ask your friends or textbooks if necessary.Overall speaking, if you have never studied calculus,it should be the toughest course in the fall semester
reviews.comment_teaching:
個半鐘個堂Lecture 係Avery上
佢算係講得幾清楚，教proofing為主。不過作為一個foundation course個重點係要識得計，而且講嘢幾悶下，走左問題唔大

reviews.author: mcli

He teach with heart in fact but there are not many people like having his lesson

homework full marks

Notes with 11x pages will be given by Zeta,you can do all of them but it will requires a lot of time
Luckily, efforts can ensure you a good grade in this course.

reviews.author: michelle hola
reviews.title: The most challenging course for fm
reviews.comment_content:
Most of them are about M2 stuff( Limit, Differentiation, Integration) with some new contents( Sandwich Theorem, Lhopital Rule).

For the details, please refer to other's reviews.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In the lecture session, Avery mainly focuses on the proving of different equations. Although they are completely trashy that could never be used in the exam, you might somehow find them interesting. Just like you know 1+1=2 , but you have never been told what caused it to be neither in primary school nor secondary school. If you want to explore the secrets of Mathematics as a Math fanactic. Go for it.

If you just want to have a good grade, you MUST go to the tutorial session, be it Kitty's or Zeta's. In Kitty's tutotial, the good thing is that her notes are very comprehensive and neat with the working steps clearly shown, despite her weakness in explaning stuff( or my weakness in understanding lol). In Zeta's tutorial, he will show many examples of different types of questions. If you are stuck at some junctures and ask him, he can point it out quickly and clarify your mind. So, depends on which way of learning you prefer, choose the tutorial to go.
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork 15%
Midterm 30%
Final 55%

Midterm: mean 20/50 sd 11
Final mean 43/100 sd 20
I have gotten ~73% overall and turns out to be B+
( Zero M1/M2 foundation in advance)
reviews.comment_workload:
Webworks are introduced about twice a month. If you are not capable of doing so, you can either go to MSC or go to Yahoo Answer.

If you are a math idiot like me, to get a better grade, finish as much exercise as you can. Only through practising will help you to explore more variety types of questions that similar questions might be asked again in the exam. At least it happened this time.

Not recommending to buy a book that is recoommended by the course, get a M2 book from your friend is better.

reviews.author: ustiong
reviews.comment_content: Same as other reviews, not too many changes, also teach from the basic limits concept, differentiation, integration and their applications.
reviews.comment_teaching:
For the main lecture, Avery taught the concepts and proofs with his hand written notes. Same contents would be written down together with students in different lecture section. But after finishing 1 topic, there was a pdf ver. notes uploaded on Avery's own website. That notes should be a part of the reference book, and almost same as Avery hand written one.

For another lecture and tutorial session, Zeta and Kitty will do their demonstrations respectively. Exercises were provided by Zeta and needed to collect from the Math Support Center. Although it was thick, it won't be too challenging for the students who had studies M1/2 during secondary school.

For the WebWork, it provided unlimited attemps so it also not a big problem. Web search is ok when doing the exercise and easy to calculate them out
reviews.comment_grading:
Overall C+.
((Haven't study M1/2 in my secondary life; All webwork exercises were finished as well
reviews.comment_workload: Some questions in Final exam were looked similar to the exercises. If you have finished all those questions, exam will be fine.

reviews.author: Luic C
reviews.comment_content:
It is M2 stuff more than M1  from what I have heard (but I didn't study M1M2 before so I can't tell the difference). But the main flow goes from precalculus->limit & continuity-> differentiation and application -> integration

Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  (1.2-1.3; Appendix A.)
Week 2 Elementary functions.  (1.5-1.6; Appendix B-D.)
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.  (2.1-2.3.)
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.  (2.5-2.7.)
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)
Week 6 Chain rule and implicit differentiation.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)
Week 7 Rates and related rates.  (3.7-3.9.)
Week 8 Maximum and minimum values.  (3.10, 4.1.)
Week 9 Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.  (4.3-4.4.)
Week 10 Curve sketching; optimization problems.  (4.5-4.7.)
Week 11 Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled.  (4.9, 5.1.)
Week 12 Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.  (5.2-5.3.)
Week 13 Net change; substitution rule.  (5.4-5.5.)
reviews.comment_teaching:
I did go to his lessons even though they are all morning 9am sections. But then after seeing the midterm exam results I realized that it is all useless. So I ditched all his lessons.
For the tutorial, the tutor doesn't seem to know what she is doing and how to tutor. So study by yourself is actually more effective than listening to their teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
For my midterm got just above mean and final above mean and I got B range.
Based on other's comments, having midterm above mean, if your final is:
above 7X%, it gives you a B range.
above 81%, it gives you a A- at least.
reviews.comment_workload:
It depends on your natural ability in the end. If you are a slow learner, than you need to pay more effort by doing all of Zeta's practices.
But the thing is there is still the last piece of webwork due before the day of the final and I almost missed that. So make sure you check very frequently for webworks until the last minute of final.

reviews.author: yh.hohoho
reviews.title: just.calculus
reviews.comment_content:
- calculus from zero

Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.
Week 2 Elementary functions.
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of a function and limit laws.
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.
Week 6 Chain rule and implicit differentiation.
Week 7 Rates and related rates.
Week 8 Maximum and minimum values.
Week 9 Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.
Week 10 Curve sketching; optimization problems.
Week 11 Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled.
Week 12 Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
Week 13 Net change; substitution rule.
reviews.comment_teaching:
4 credits course:
. 2 lectures per week by avery
. 1 lecture per week by zeta
. 1 tutorial per week by kitty

. avery does the proof, but... boring (?)
. zeta teaches his own things, exams oriented
. kitty seems to be nice, might be good to ask her in cantonese after class... no comment
reviews.comment_grading:
students enrolled have varied math skills.
mean for midterm and final < 50%, although questions are really not hard if you have some sense of math

good grade overall, at least better than its counterparts, and no need to work too hard if you are not pursuing an A+ which is reachable
- getting sth around 80 can still put you into A range.
reviews.comment_workload:
i skipped most of the classes, so no workload besides webwork once a week
9 webwork: really light for a 4 credits course

. symbolab
. khan academy
will be good friends of yours!

reviews.author: ptrknow
reviews.comment_content:
Please refer to other comments.

Note that the pace of teaching is fast. Spending effort to keep up with the pace is quite a must.
reviews.comment_teaching:
CHENG, Kam Heng:
Yes. I attend MATH1013's lecture instead of 1012's. Avery is quite infamous afterall.

Henry prepares very detailed notes and additional practices (which are very difficult), but you may need to individually ask him in order to gain the access on canvas.

He will write out all the stuff (proofs and solutions) on the whiteboard. Making sure you are with him when he is writing.

There is a break within every lecture. Feel free to ask him questions when in doubt. His explanation is generally detailed and understandable.
Right before midterm and final, he will teach us to do some past paper questions. 1013's questions are really challenging when compared to 1012's.

Zeta Chan:
Exam-oriented style. You should take a copy of his note and do practices on the questions of the note. This is particularly important for those who didn't study M2 before.

His explanation to solving questions is clear. Attending his tutorial is really quite optional because there are recorded videos uploaded on canvas afterwards. Of course, you might need to ask him questions and you better attend the tutorial if so (there will be more guys waiting for him in MSC).
reviews.comment_grading:
Maybe.. fair? I guess.

Midterm
Overall mean: 20/50 (40%)   Overall SD: 10.1 (20.2%)

Final
Mean of my class: 47/100   SD of my class: not announced yet

My mark for reference:
Webwork (15%): 100/100
Midterm (30%): 30/50
Final (55%): 91/100
Overall: 83/100
Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
This might be an easy course for those who had dropped M2, but this is absolutely not the case for those who didn't take M2 at all (except that you are a genius).

If you had no M2 background before (like me), constant effort is mandatory and required in order to secure a better grade.

This is gonna be tough. Good luck.

reviews.author: anony262
reviews.title: Lube up
reviews.comment_content:
Content is pretty okay if I'm being honest. I did IB Math Studies (lol) and I was able to eventually understand and comprehend everything, so don't be too worried if you're bad at math. The main focus of this course is limits, derivatives, and integration. Everything else is minor and is just based off those main three.

Make sure you understand related rates and optimization. They love to test on those!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Just. No. You can get much better teaching from the following links:

Organic Chem (Math) Tutor https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rCxi-O79sVo&list=PL0o_zxa4K1BVKErFko9je9IBZ0hXWXVtV

and KhanAcademy
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork - Straightforward. If you're struggling you can go to the math support center OR copy and paste the question into Google. 9/10 there will be a solution on Yahoo answers.

Midterm - Holy hell. Literally the WORST paper I have ever laid eyes on in my life. You know it's bad when the guy next to you opens the paper and says "f*ck". The mean was 19.9/50. Let that sink in. Not even 50%. Worst paper ever. Thankfully, Avery noticed that maybe he made it slightly too challenging...

Final - So so so so so much better. Avery heard our pleas and made this paper so much easier. For once I didn't want to kill myself mid-exam. This is the only reason I'm giving grading a B.
reviews.comment_workload: So much workload if you're new to the calculus. I remember staying up late every night doing the practice problems from Zeta's tutorial class (which, by the way, are much easier than the exam questions). If you work hard enough and try to understand the techniques and reasoning behind the theories, you'll do great.   Highly recommend watching videos explaining the concepts.

reviews.author: Rainbowmakssci
reviews.title: Good professor Average grade
reviews.comment_content: All M2 stuff, DSE level. But it is so tedious if you have no fundamental math background as it is a 4 credit bearing course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher emphasises on self learning process such as flipped class. He is lenient to students and I think he is capable to teach.
reviews.comment_grading:
Average

Mid term mean 17, highest 44 I got 21, just above mean. I predict I can have a B- if I continue to be above mean
reviews.comment_workload: Very light, only 3 canvas questions per 2 weeks (around) Go to lessons on time for attendance marks

reviews.author: Leon H
reviews.comment_content:
Basic concepts of calculus including differentiation and integration.

1. Pre-calculus
2. Limits
3. Differentiation
4. Intergration
reviews.comment_teaching: Since I have never attend any of the classes, nothing much I can say about the teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
If you have learn calculus before, it won't be a problem to get an A range.

I never attended any of the lectures or tutorials and got more 48/50 in midterm and 90/100 in final. Got an A+ at the end.

Grading Scheme:
WebWork 15%
Midterm    30%
Final         55%
reviews.comment_workload:
Just remember to finish the webwork in time. It doesn't matter how many attempts you try. As long as you get the answer right in the end you'll get a full mark in the homework part.

Zero workload for those who have learned some basic calculus concepts before.

reviews.author: TH WONG
reviews.title: A nice course for students without calculus background
reviews.comment_content:
1) Pre-calculus (including types of various functions etc.)
2) Limit (limit, asymptotes etc.)
3) Differentiation (differentiation techniques, L’Hospital’s Rule, curve sketching etc.)
4) Integration (indefinite integral, summation, fundamental theorem of calculus)

The course introduces the basics of calculus to students without DSE M1/M2. I think this course is indeed very suitable for beginners. And thanks to this course, I could then handle MATH 1014 in spring.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Ching is quite good at explaining the basic ideas in calculus. As a beginner, I think his lectures are effective to introduce me the new concepts.

TA Zeta is very helpful and his tutorial notes are good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork 15%
Midterm exam 35%
Final exam 50%

As this course is the basic course, the calculations in the exams aren't very difficult, and the questions are quite straight forward.

Webwork: 100/100
Midterm: 45/50 (mean around 28, sd around 14)
Final: 95/100 (mean & sd forgot)
Overall 94%, A+

The grading is reasonable and quite good.
reviews.comment_workload: The only homework is the webwork, so the workload is quite light. But the time for revision varies from student to student and it depends a lot on where you are aiming. Spending more effort is recommended if you aim high. The exercises in the text book and the tutorial notes are useful.

reviews.author: tschanag
reviews.comment_content:
Basic calculus
Includes limit, differential calculus, integral calculus.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Avery's teaching makes the course hard to follow.

TA Kitty Lee's tutorials were far from satisfactory. Not only her tone was larthargic, but also with an extremely slow teaching speed.

TA Zeta Chan Yun Hung was very helpful. He explained the steps,tho not quite thoroughly, and provided enough practice questions for us. You can find him at MSC.

My course is 9am class and I often skipped lectures of Avery. I stopped going to the tutorial since I found that useless.

I think Youtube and khan academy helped me a lot in understanding the course. So even if you skip lectures, it will be totally fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 100%
Midterm 78%
Final 83%
Overall 84% Graded A
reviews.comment_workload:
Webwork was easy and had only 9 throughout the whole sem.

Tutorial notes from Zeta had many questions, but it is optional. Finishing them all will make this course a heavy workload. So I tried to finish it by skipping some easy questions.

Overall, this course is quite easy.

Topics include functions and their limits, continuity, derivatives and rules of differentiation, applications of derivatives, and basic integral calculus.

reviews.author: NTS
reviews.title: MATH 1012
reviews.comment_content:
Basically DSE M2 Content, but for non-M1 and non-M2 takers

Official textbook for MATH 1012:
J. Stewart, Calculus Early Transcendentals, 7th edition, Brooks/Cole.
 
Tentative Teaching Schedule:
Week 1 - Functions and graphs, exponential functions, transformations of graphs
Week 2 - Logarithmic functions, trigonometric functions
Week 3 - Trigonometric identities, concept of a limit
Week 4 - One-sided limits, infinite limits and limits at infinity
Week 5 - Continuity, concept of a derivative
Week 6 - Differentiation rules
Week 7 - Chain rule, implicit differentiation
Week 8 - Higher derivatives, rate and related rates
Week 9 - Mean Value Theorem (MVT), minimum and maximum
Week 10 - Optimization, L'Hopital Rule
Week 11 - Anti-derivatives, indefinite integrals
Week 12 - Definite integrals, Fundamental Theorem of Calculus (FTC)
Week 13 - Substitution method

Actually not different from MATH 1013, just to separate students into 2 groups
reviews.comment_teaching:
Albert Ku did try to make the lesson more funny, but seems unsuccessful..
For the content taught, some methods and ways he explained will simply make you further confused..
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork or canvas homework
Midterm
Final

I think the grading is fine but not very good
reviews.comment_workload:
For L1 L2, webwork is used and you will eventually know the answer..
But for L3, canvas is used and there is a limit on the attempts on questions.. a little unfair and demanding..

An introduction to calculus. The content is almost the same with calculus 1B, but a simplified version.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Avery Ching's lecture is quite clear, but boring. You can skip the lectures and it won't be a problem. Mostly he prove formulas during his lectures. There are 3 lectures per week, and Avery teaches 2 of them. The third lecture is taught by the TA, Chan Yun-Hyung. It is better, plus he gives out lecture notes on his lecture.

The tutorials are more helpful than lectures, as the TA discuss problems, not just concepts like in lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is better than math1013's grading. The mean for mid and final is around 50-60. Getting an A is definitely possible. Just do the problems in the lecture notes given by the TA, study the past papers, and you will be fine.

Grading scheme:
15% webwork
35% mid
50% final
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork almost every week, not bad as you can try to solve the problems as much as you can without any deduction. Getting 100% in webwork is really easy, as there is no limit on the number of tries. The webwork is almost the same with math1013. I think there is a total of 9 webworks with around 10 questions each.

reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is quite clear, he will ask us if we can follow or have any problem. He will explain each steps clearly and give us example then exercise in each topic during lessons to help us have a better understanding, even better than going to tutorial. I even don't need to go to the tutorial section
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm quite easy, if do enough practise, can get high mark.
Final have some difficult questions, but have enough time to deal with it.
As the course do not have NDS(i think), the mean will not be too high.
If do enough practise can get good grade

Midterm:Full 50, mean28.4 High: 50 My score:46
Final:Full 100, mean 47.3 High:97  My score:88
Grading A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Not really heavy workload, no webwork but some Exercise on canvas instead, usually 3-4 question about each topic. Exercise is not hard to let us practise the basic concept.
In other words, the practise is not enough, so have to do more other exercise  to get more fundamental practise.
I just borrow the Dse M2 textbk from my friend and do the  exercise inside.

reviews.author: Sunny Ng
reviews.title: A good start to calculus.
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 - Functions and graphs, exponential functions, transformations of graphs
Week 2 - Logarithmic functions, trigonometric functions
Week 3 - Trigonometric identities, concept of a limit
Week 4 - One-sided limits, infinite limits and limits at infinity
Week 5 - Continuity, concept of a derivative
Week 6 - Differentiation rules
Week 7 - Chain rule, implicit differentiation
Week 8 - Higher derivatives, rate and related rates
Week 9 - Mean Value Theorem (MVT), minimum and maximum
Week 10 - Optimization, L'Hopital Rule
Week 11 - Anti-derivatives, indefinite integrals
Week 12 - Definite integrals, Fundamental Theorem of Calculus (FTC)
Week 13 - Substitution method

The course starts from the very beginning, where you learn about functions and limits before stepping into the world of calculus. As seen from the schedule above, the course content is not extremely tough, but students with no calculus background might find the exams a little bit challenging.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Albert is a decent lecturer. He is capable of delivering the course contents in an effective way. He places a lot of effort in making powerpoints, online self-learning materials as well as assignments and quizzes. He is very willing to answer students' questions and explains mathematical problems with examples in a good and logical way. If you attend all the lessons, understand the examples and work on the practices, you will do fine.

The TA, Kitty, is fair. She prepares a lot of exercises for practicing the learned topics. However, her delivery in English is average. She sometimes looks shy and speaks really softly.
reviews.comment_grading:
35% mid-term exam
50% final exam (includes everything)

Not much explanation needed here. The exams are pretty tough so it is important to make sure that you understand the concepts and practice regularly. If you do so, it is not surprising to end up with the A range.

10% online exercises

There are weekly online exercises, which in most cases, only consist of less than 5 questions. They are based on the online self-learning materials and are not too hard.  You can surely complete them within an hour.

5% class participation

Every week, there will be an in-class quiz and a group task. They are not long and they take up around an hour together. Both test our knowledge on the online self-learning materials posted on canvas. If you get a decent score, bonus points will be awarded, which counts for class participation.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload really depends on how hard you push yourself.

Apart from the weekly online exercises, there are no other homework or assignments. You only need to spend an hour outside lesson time.

However, it is highly recommended that you do regular exercises on taught topics and understand everything or else you will struggle before and during the exam.

reviews.author: tsepikling
reviews.title: Actually simple enough for beginners
reviews.comment_content:
I never study calculus before(in HKDSE). However, I found the difficulty of the course is reasonable and the instructor could explain those concepts with graphs or detailed procedures. Quite a lot of topics but the questions were not at an advanced level so beginners also can catch up easily.

I don't like Piazza. It is too difficult to use, especially for a mobile phone user.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is nice and responsible, he can explain the concepts clearly with his powerpoint but a bit of boring as he always waits for student's responses. All in all, he did a good job. However, the tutor( Kitty) could not explain the question very clearly and personally I think the tutorial is useless, I only attended for 3(?) lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got A+. Midterm:49/50. Final:90/100. Overall: about 92%.
I never study M1/M2 so the course is not that difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: Not very large. But I had one online quiz/assignment on Canvas every week, once I was late, the mark was deducted by 50%. So u must keep on doing the assignment and check the deadline.

reviews.author: asdfqwg349sfd
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  (1.2-1.3; Appendix A.)
Week 2 Elementary functions.  (1.5-1.6; Appendix B-D.)
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of a function and limit laws.  (2.1-2.3.)
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.  (2.5-2.7.)
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)
Week 6 Chain rule and implicit differentiation.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)
Week 7 Rates and related rates.  (3.7-3.9.)
Week 8 Mean Value Theorem. Maximum and minimum values.  (3.10, 4.1.)
Week 9 Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.  (4.3-4.4.)
Week 10 Curve sketching; optimization problems.  (4.5-4.7.)
Week 11 Antiderivatives; areas and distance traveled.  (4.9, 5.1.)
Week 12 Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.  (5.2-5.3.)
Week 13 Net change; substitution rule.  (5.4-5.5.)

Assessment

Final Exam: 50%

Grading is actually pretty good.
Midterm: 30.26 (average), 12.58 (SD) out of 50
Final: 48.44 (average), 23.75 (SD) out of 100
I got 1SD above in both of my exams and got an A
reviews.comment_workload: Almost Weekly workload. It is doable but it requires some time.
