reviews.author: app_Sci
reviews.title: Suffering is a must if you are in SSCI or SENG that were forced to take this course without any M2 background.
reviews.comment_content:
The course teaches about 60% of M2 materials in 3 months for those who did not have M2 in HKDSE exam. Me myself found M2 textbooks very helpful in MATH 1012.
(Yes, M1 materials are less helpful than M2 materials.)
The teaching pace is indeed very fast, going through functions, limits, derivatives, application of derivatives and integrals in the 3 months.
quite chur for those who did not study any extended math in secondary school, like me.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He puts handwritten lecture notes in his course website.
If you are good in self-study, you do not have to go to his lectures and you can just read the lecture notes to learn.
His overall teaching is satisfactory.
I would recommend you to go to Zeta's lecture instead, his lecture is quite exercise- based.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is based on mean and SD.
The mean of exams would be around 55% and SD about 25% (Very big!)
I am above mean 0.5 SD and got a B+.
Because of big SD, even you are pretty far away from the mean, you cannot get very high marks.
In some posts, it was said that you could not get full credit if you do not answer using his method, but this is not true. In midterm, I answered a long question which involves limits. I made some very minor mistakes in my steps (like forgetting to put plus after the limit), got the correct answer anyway. I was granted full credit for that particular question afterall.
reviews.comment_workload: There is only webwork, and a midterm and a final. Although it sounds little, the questions in midterm and final often requires you to think more than what was mentioned in lecture notes and webwork, thus, you need to do lots of exercise outside class.

If you master the basics and practice regularly, then you should get a good grade

Those who did not study M1/M2 before need more effort to catch up since the content of this course is similar to 1013 and one should not expect that this course is easier than 1013

Otherwise, if you only want to develop practical skills in doing maths, the lecture is boring to you, just go for the tutorial in this case. The TA's teaching is pretty good and his advice is precise and accurate.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is pretty fair I would say. Overall 83% having an A grade is surprising comparing to 1013 which adopts absolute grading (B+ in that case).

I skipped almost all lectures and tutorial in this semester and still manage to take the exams. Just make sure you can do all the webworks by yourself and you should be fine.
However, it really depends whether you have studied M1/M2 or not. In my case I did so not much extra effort is needed.

reviews.author: CourseReviewer
reviews.comment_content:
Content is suitable for beginners in Calculus, although the pace is quite fast and there are a lot of topics to cover. Definitely should practice from the textbooks as they give you the correct mindset to solve problems.

Topics include:
Functions and their graphs;
Trigonometric functions, exponential and log functions and their inverses;
Limits, asymptotes of graphs, continuity;
Derivatives of elementary functions, product and quotient rules, chain rule.
Implicit differentiations.
Rate of changes.
Extremums of functions. The mean value theorem.
Increasing and Decreasing functions. Curve sketching.
Optimizations.
L'hôpital rule.
Riemann sums and definite integrals. The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
Integration by Substitution.

Don't freak out when the professor gives you extremely difficult past papers, I promise you that in reality, the midterms and the finals aren't that difficult!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Although the professor (CHING, Avery) is very smart, he is unable to teach well; it is quite difficult to follow what he is saying in lectures. He starts off with easy, understandable concepts, and the other minute he immediately starts solving a very difficult problem.

Similarly, the TA (CHAN, Yun Hung) often teaches in lectures as well. It's quite difficult to understand his accent, plus his teaching is worse than Avery's. Plus, although he can be approached in the MSC, he seems to "look down" on you.

The other TA (AU, Cheuk Yin), however, is the reason why the teaching of this course got a D and not an E. He is very, very useful in tutorials, and his way of teaching is very easy to understand. In addition, he is highly approachable and always seems to be ready to help you.
reviews.comment_grading:
If you have studied Calculus before, I don't think the grading is going to be a huge problem for you, because the midterm is relatively easy. Final was tough. The mean is also crazy high due to the fact that many people have studied Calculus.  (although, the content is really much! After all, it is a 4 credit course).

15%: WebWork
35%: Midterms
50%: Finals

Midterm: Mean: 30/50, SD: 12/50
Finals: Mean: 54/100, SD: 26/100

I got 36/50 and 62/100 with full WebWork
Received a B.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload in this course is only the bi-weekly Webwork that you need to do.

There are 10 of them, and one of them accounts for 1.5% of your final grade.

reviews.author: DoWtAr
reviews.comment_content:
Not really easy for those who didn't study M1/M2 in their secondary school.

You have to give a high effort to learn the content by yourself if you skip the lessons.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite useful, he had prepared some notes and online learning materials for us.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is actually not that good, both my midterm and exam are above mean 0.5 sd and I finished all the webworks and turned out I earned a C+.

TBH, AVERY Ching is giving a better grade. Therefore, you better study it well in the fall semester.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light, there are only 1 mid-term , 1 final and 6/7 webworks.

reviews.author: RobYuen
reviews.title: F to B+, big thanks to the retake
reviews.comment_content: The content shifts to MATH1013, which is the same as 1012 with ~3 more theorems. Still tough when you failed the course last semester.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Intensive course based on practical problems. It should be a lot better than theory lectures if you do not understand theories, at least you can learn from exercises.

Prof. LAM and a lot of TAs are available to solve your questions with patience.

Overall good because mathematics needs intensive and repetitive training, and it is compulsory in this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got a B+, from an F in the fall semester

Classwork: 25%
You have to complete webwork assignments of around 30 questions twice a week, IN PERSON (essentially means attendance), however there are TAs available to ask.
Tutorial Quizzes: 20%
After the morning classwork, you get to a 3-5 question webwork quiz in the afternoon, this time there is no help from TAs.
Final Exam: 55%
Better than the fall semester one by Avery, easier, and most importantly you can have 1 piece of cheat sheet.
reviews.comment_workload: When you have to go to school twice a week, 10 to 4, during holidays, it is of course heavy. Though the grade is worth the work.

reviews.author: Pear
reviews.comment_content:
Just an introductory course of calculus
It covers most of differentiation but only till the beginning of integration
Integration of volume is out of syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Avery a very smart teacher
He can just write forever on the blackboard
He defines the definitions very clearly.
His accent is acceptable
However, it can be quite hard to keep up with his pace because there are many things that he expects you to understand when he skips some of the steps
So i would suggest going to tutorials and MSC. It helps a lot
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is pretty good in my opinion
my overall percentage was around 70% and i got A-
The exams and midterms are very hard, they are all very conceptual based.
You have to really understand the derivation of most theorems to be able to grasp a direction to solve Avery's questions
reviews.comment_workload: I would say that theres a lot of stuff to be learnt if you have never learnt any m2. You do have to put in a notible amount of effort to fully understand the concepts and apply them to the questions.

reviews.author: fanmatthew
reviews.comment_content: Although the course are created for students who didn't take or scored below level 3 in M2 in DSE, the content is exactly the same with 1013, student who skips all lesson might find hard to follow. But it doesn't take much time and effort to score above mean in mid-term and final.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pof. Ching's teaching is one of the best I have experienced in Science School. His pronunciation is loud and clear, the speed of speech is quite fast but still easy to follow. One thing to be noticed is that he speaks "Chin-glish", which is surprisingly fine for me as it's recognizable for local students like me.
reviews.comment_grading: I personally think this course's grading system is best for student like me, who is lazy and skips almost all lecture, and still hopes to score in B range.
reviews.comment_workload: This course has about 10 something webworks, and also a special lecture in the end of week which you have to finish a classwork before the end of it. There's no quizzes but only one mid-term and one final exam. The workload is overall good.

reviews.comment_content: Very basic. If you've studied calculus before, you should have no problem regarding the content of this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: At times, you may be better off not attending the lectures - the lecturer has a tendency of making simple calculations/steps incredibly confusing.
reviews.comment_grading: Scoring the mean will give you a C. Their way of marking exams (whether it be midterm or final) is very specific - if you do not follow specific steps to obtain the final answer, you'll get a third of the overall mark for the question despite getting the correct answer. In your answers, you'll also have to be clear and precise; otherwise, no marks will be given for your points unfortunately.
reviews.comment_workload: With webwork due every week, along with a "quiz", workload is adequate.

reviews.author: Simon Suen
reviews.comment_content: all M2 syllabus in secondary school, you need to study all of these during 3 months
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Xu is patient to answer your question, but the lesson is quite difficult to understand the accent, so you may need to learn the knowledge from internet
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is quite lenient since the mean of the mid-term exam is only 30/100 with sd 25 while I got 18/100, but the final exam mean is 60/100 while I got 80/100, and the final grade is B.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 18 assignments during the whole course with unlimited chances to try the assignment, then you can get all the assignment mark(20%)

reviews.comment_teaching:
Hu, Jishan is quite good at explaining the concept and tryna prove and finish the examples shown in the textbook detailedly. However, if you have learnt some, it is okay for you to skip the lectures, which are taught at a very slow pace.
The tutorial is good to attend. There are 2 tutors that I will recommend are  Hoi Sang KONG and Phyllis LIANG.
KONG Hoi Sang is also good at explaining the problems given in the tutorial notes. And in his notes, he had screened some 'useless' questions. You don't need to waste time on classviva:) Just finish the questions in his notes.
Phyllis' notes are good for you to clean the concept. Her lessons are fast-paced and you may get the feeling of having secondary lessons, which may be adaptable for you(?)

Feel free to go to math support center. Those tutors are really nice to solve your problem :)
reviews.comment_grading:
There was originally 1 grading scheme before the midterm. But there was another grading scheme after the marks of MT is released.(maybe because the mean of MT is shit)
This is not absolute grading.

scheme 1: homework 20%, mid-term test 30%, final exam 50%;
scheme 2: homework 20%, mid-term test 10%, final exam 70%.

My final didn't cover the part of integration and cover a lot on the L'Hopital rule. If you want to get full marks on the long question, you may tryna read the tutorial notes' answers and remember the format, they grade it strictly:)

My result:
Homework:100/100 (Mean:79.55/100)
Mid-term:70.5/100(Mean:33.91/100)
Finale:92/100(Mean:58.18/100)
Total: 91.45(Mean:62.09/100)
And I got an A in this course.
Seems 88% can get an A, 94% A+
reviews.comment_workload:
If you like Maths and you are willing to finish those exercises in tutorial notes, you will probably get a good grade.
Two assignments per month. You can finish it within 2 hours. Unlimited attempts so no worry.

reviews.author: Jack0001000
reviews.title: The first chapter of suffering in HKUST
reviews.comment_content:
Basic calculus, like the course title suggests.
Basic introduction like domain, set, trigonometry at the start, then differentiation and its applications all the way until after midterm, and at last (very) basic integration. This semester’s final exam cuts integration out completely because of the midterm disaster, more details in the grading section.

The course design is quite good, with 2 lectures, one supplementary lecture (taught by TA) and 1 tutorial each week,
reviews.comment_teaching:
TU is a definite piece of evidence that an extremely talented person in maths may not have any talent in mathematics education. He tried to teach us who never had any experience in calculus delta-epsilon proof in the 2nd week, and failed spectacularly. I’ve heard even the UG maths coordinator got involved to ‘ask’ him to be more considerate of our maths level.

On top of this, he has very thick accent. It was very difficult to understand what he is trying to say. One of my classmates even made a whole list of words he pronounced weirdly, so that’s the only thing we can laugh about in this course I guess.

But if you want to hear about some of his redeeming qualities, he seems like a pretty chill guy outside of class time. He is willing to share some details of his earlier life if you ask in Mandarin. Also it’s his first year teaching here, so his lack of experience is sort of expected.

If the prof is Yin, the TA Phyllis is the Yang, more respectfully known as the hand that gives MATH1012 students another life. Others have said enough, so I’m not going to repeat the details, just remember that tutorials are very important and that don’t skip it unless you really need to.
reviews.comment_grading:
Curved grading.

The midterm is a nightmare, with the mean score being 30.XX out of 100, with ‘most students in the 0-40 range’. This  forced the introduction of 2 grading schemes:
1: 20% homework + 30% midterm + 50% final
2: 20% homework + 10% midterm + 70% final
The final exam is better, with a mean of 54 something. I guess they are more lenient in the final.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload, with 8 homework on classviva spaced throughout the semester. Try your best to get 100% on all of these so your grade might be saved in the end. Also, you can get lots of voluntary exercise on this website, so get to work.

reviews.author: ifunmd
reviews.title: Written by a Jupas student who did not have calculus background
reviews.comment_content: Other reviews have provided all the details, so I'm not gonna repeat here.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I self-studied in the summer holiday which contibutes a lot to my A+.

DON'T expect that you can learn everything in this 4-credit course in just 3 months if you have not studied any calculus before, especially under the circumstance that Prof HU only likes to talk about proof with an uncomfortable accent(that's why he taught slowly and the majority think his teaching is worst).

Make use of any resources to prepare for this course before the course begin if you want to get A- or above (if you are not one of those math genius).

Tutorials are generally better than lectures though.

For me the overall teaching is B.
reviews.comment_grading:
In this semester two grading schemes are adopted.

Weights under scheme 1:
Hw 0.2 Mterm 0.3 Final 0.5

Weights under scheme 2:
Hw 0.2 Mterm 0.1 Final 0.7

The scheme with a higher overall grade will be automatically adopted.The reason for using two grading schemes is probably most of us were not doing well in Mterm. Mterm was more diffcult than the final from my perspective.

Worth noting that Intergration were taught but were not included in Final since Prof HU taught slowly.

There are unlimited attempts for assignments and only the highest grade of each one will be recorded.

For L1 scores please refer to the attachment.

I would have given the grading a C if there are no two grading schemes.
reviews.comment_workload:
One assignment every two weeks on Classviva.

The last assignment (intergration) was hard since Prof HU taught slowly so only 2 lectures and 1 tutorial are for teaching intergration. However the techniques required in HW8 were far beyond what he had taught in those lessons so I paid more efforts in it.

If you have no calculus background, you need to self-study before the course begin and do more extra exercises in order to get a good grade. This will result in a higher workload, of course. For people not aiming high, just do some extra exercises and you will get a B-range.

For me the overall workload is C.

This is an introductory course in one-variable calculus, the first in the Calculus I and II sequence, designed for students that have not taken HKDSE Mathematics Extended Module M1 or M2. reviews.author: kiwiau
reviews.title: 高中無讀 M2 人
reviews.comment_content:
Basic calculus, half of DSE M2 coverage.
Week 1: Number, inequalities and absolutes, basic functions and graphs, composite functions Week 2: Exponential functions, trigonometric functions, inverse functions, logarithmic functions, inverse trigonometric functions
Week 3: Tangent and velocity, the limit of a function, limit laws
Week 4: Continuity, limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes, derivatives and rates of change
Week 5: Basic derivatives, product and quotient rules, derivatives of trigonometric functions
Week 6: Chain rule, implicit differentiation, derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions and logarithmic functions
Week 7: Rates of change problems, related rates
Week 8: Maximum and minimum values
Week 9: Derivatives and graphs, L’Hôpital’s rule
Week 10: Curve sketching, optimization problems
Week 11: Antiderivatives, areas
Week 12: Definite integrals, the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
Week 13: Indefinite integrals and net change, the substitution rule

Really not a lot but you need long time for getting used to calculus.

reviews.comment_content:
1. Derive the inverse function of a given function
2. Limits

4. Find the derivative from the definition
5. Chain rule
6. Implicit differentiation and tangent line
7. Rate of change

9. Optimization problem
10. L'Hôpital's rule
11. Curve sketching
12. Indefinite integrals and definite integrals
reviews.comment_teaching:
-I only attended the first 2-3 lectures and skipped the rest. I wasn't interested in the class since I did calculus in high school. I would go watch them on triple speed before the final to make sure I am not missing anything.

-The instructor proves lots of theorems and identities, but I am not sure if it helps those with no calculus background. I prefer to start with explanations that are based on visualizations and intuition before doing the rigorous ones.

-Some of the study notes are useful.

-Phyllis LIANG is good and her explanations are always clear and helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
No midterm, and one 2-hour final.
Webwork Weight: 25% (9 problem-sets and you have an infinite number of trials).
Final Exam Weight:  75%

Final Mean: 42.93%
Total Mean: 54.42%

Webwork: 100%
Final: 94%
A+
reviews.comment_workload:
There are 9 homework problem sets on webwork. Some questions are tricky, and it is wise to allow a good time to solve them, though some of them are classical and repeated.

If you are planning to take this course, solve as many problems from the textbook as you can, or follow YouTube teachers, I recommend bprp.

reviews.comment_content: DSE M2 thing, h
reviews.comment_teaching: Chan is not bad at teaching, he tried hard to enhance your interest in math and he also gave a little short break if he found most of us tired. However, this course is about basic calculus. It is not a thing that you are not able to learn if you don't attend the lecture. so I skipped most of his class.
reviews.comment_grading:
No midterm
Assignments: 25%
Exam:  75%
I got 68 in the final which the mean is 56.20 and SD is 19.80
It turns out A-
(I am above 0.9995 SD and get A- ,and I saw someone is above 1 SD and get A, fml)
reviews.comment_workload: There would be 9 homework. Each has 2 weeks for you to do. Some homework questions are quite difficult that I needed to google. So It is quite heavy if you are not that good at math.

reviews.author: 化工之鬼
reviews.title: Best introduction course for student with no calculus background
reviews.comment_content:
I have zero calculus background in high school as I didn't take the extended module in mathematics in the HKDSE syllabus, but I still catch up all the content without any difficulty.

fyi I got a 5** in core maths in HKDSE so take that as a reference.

Topics
1 Number, inequalities and absolutes (Appendix A), basic functions and graphs,
composite functions (1.1, 1.2, 1.3)
2 Exponential functions (1.5), trigonometric functions, inverse functions,
logarithmic functions, inverse trigonometric functions (1.6)
3 Tangent and velocity (2.1), the limit of a function, limit laws (2.2, 2.3)
4 Continuity (2.5), limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes (2.6), derivatives and
rates of change (2.7)
5 Basic derivatives (2.8, 3.1), product and quotient rules (3.2), derivatives of
trigonometric functions (3.3)
6 Chain rule (3.4), implicit differentiation, derivatives of inverse trigonometric
functions and logarithmic functions (3.5, 3.6)
7 Rates of change problems (3.7, 3.8), related rates (3.9)
8 Maximum and minimum values (4.1)
9 Derivatives and graphs (4.3), L’Hôpital’s rule (4.4)
10 Curve sketching (4.5, 4.6), optimization problems (4.7)
11 Antiderivatives (4.9), areas (5.1)
12 Definite integrals (5.2), the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus (5.3)
13 Indefinite integrals and net change (5.4), the substitution rule. (5.5)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Chan is a great professor, at least better than the other three. he got great local accent but you can definitely understand what is he saying.
his lesson is also pretty interesting. he uses three to four examples to illustrate the topics covered per lesson, you will definitely get a satisfactory grade if you attend all his lectures.

Phyllis is also a great TA. my friends who don't have Phyllis as their TA come take her class. she uses colour printed notes, using tons of examples to illustrate the concept, which makes my progress to be reasonable. you may ask her questions in cantonese, English or mandarin and she got a reasonable accent as a mainlander.
reviews.comment_grading:
this course originally uses absolute grading, but it somehow changed to relative grading which is such a good news to me for this semester. I will only get a A- under absolute grading.

Webwork: 100% (weighting 25%)
Final: 85% (weighting: 75%)
Total: 88.25% A+ Thanks God!

REMEMBER EFFORT PAYS OFF!!!!!
WHEN YOU LOVE MATH, MATH WILL LOVE YOU.
reviews.comment_workload: this course give you one webwork assignment per one to two week, if you don't do any additional exercises, workload will definitely be a a+. if you aim higher, you may do exercise in the textbook, they have adequate difficulty and suitable for you to clear your concepts, but it may result in a b- in workload

reviews.author: ligmaballz
reviews.title: GO STUDY M2 BEFORE GOING TO UST
reviews.comment_content: like what the title says study M2 before coming here. If you do so congrats there is nothing to be afraid in this 3 months.You don't even need to listen to any lectures by doing so.as the lectures are boring and worthless.no attendence and quizzes.
reviews.comment_teaching: so boring. what the TA does is just write everything on the screen, fill in the blanks on her worksheet. just watch the zoom cloud recordings to learn if you need.
reviews.comment_grading: if you have M1/M2 knowledge, then you can get high marks easily. As most people in here doesn't and the teaching sucks, most people has low marks. for my section the final exam mean is just 30 sth.
reviews.comment_workload: homework only. have 9 homework in total. released about weekly. unlimited attempts for trying. ask your TA by email if you don't know how to do. basically free 25% total marks for everyone. especially the early homework are secondary maths only. Final is the big boss of this course, 75% for the whole course. Study the past papers and re do the webwork. then you can make it.

reviews.author: T2
reviews.title: DON'T REG IN SPRING SEM
reviews.comment_content: a bit difficult for me as I never studied M1/2.
reviews.comment_teaching:
very bad. Very boring and I skip most of the lectures.

He used his own notes during the lectures and uploaded them to canvas after lectures
reviews.comment_grading: not good. You need to spend time understanding the concepts. I recommend to you watch youtube videos rather than listen to the lectures.
reviews.comment_workload: need to open cam when doing the online exercises. There is one assignment in each tutorial. There are both mid-term exams and final exam. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE IN SPRING SEM!!! much more workload compared to fall semester

reviews.author: japholic
reviews.title: 自求多福，多做練習吧
reviews.comment_content:
一開始係數學野，之後加D DSE M2野
-Function; trigo etc
-Limit
-Differentiation & its application; rate of change
- Integration (definite and infinite)
無vector; matrix; linear system,算係甘，本身好似有埋vector，有既話就更加慘不忍睹...
*本身之前有讀M2，但係成績唔理想
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor 大部分lecture我都無上(一開始有認真上架==)，睇佢D handwritten notes以為自己上緊英文堂，因為佢係到prove緊點解有個個theory。

要學野其實上tutorial就ok，有唔明白就開口問啦 (Tutors: Phyllis幾nice,D notes都ok) 唔係比D都係比面Phyllis咋QQ
reviews.comment_grading:
Mark allocation:
- Webwork （25%)
-1 Final exam,全部MCQ (X midterm this time) ~75%，好重weighting QAQ
>> Mean: 12/22 （在下不才，得11/22，最後B-）

考既同教既差OK 遠，只係溫web work + tutorial notes 應該可以勉強合格 QQ 算係killer course ==

最癲係professor 派grade個陣send 封電郵，裡面有呢句： failing one course is not the end of the world... 無玩啦，如果你aim high 但係同在下一樣係數學小白，fail一個coursen你已經失去幾多野（e.g. first hon ;-)）...
reviews.comment_workload:
有時一個月1-2 份web work，但係臨final就比得勁密...
只係做web work其實唔chur,但係你aim high 做extra drilling就另計了...

reviews.author: AzzAzAAzzzAza
reviews.comment_content:
This is the basic course of calculus, including inverse functions, limits, derivatives and integration.

If you have M2 lessons in secondary school, this course should be quite easy.
reviews.comment_teaching:
***I take this lecture during the period of COVID-19
Professor Avery has good knowledge in this area. However, the lecture is boring, and he seldom cares questions during the lecture (I guess he performs the lesson by I-pad and cannot see the questions). One time his screen is frozen, and he just keeps talking for half an hour, ignoring all the reminders by the students.

Regarding the content, the lecture gives proof of equations, which is, USELESS in the exam or your homework. You may join the lecture if you are curious about the proof but if you only care about the grade, you should join the Tutorials and lectures of the tutor. She gives a clear presentation and gives useful content.

For me, I skip all the lectures after the incident. I learn from Khan Academy during the lecture time. I only join the Tutorials and lectures of the tutor.
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork: 25%
Final Exam 75%

***I take this lecture during the period of COVID-19

You have unlimited attempts for the webwork, so everyone is likely to get full marks in that part.

The Final Exam is all MCs. Open notes but no calculators are allowed. Better have lady luck smiles on you.

My case:
Final Exam: 14/22
and I got B+
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork is given around every 1-2 weeks. It takes around 1-3 hours.

reviews.author: Ben仔
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1

Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  (1.1-1.3; Appendix A.)

Week 2

Elementary functions.  (1.5-1.6; Appendix B-D.)

Week 3

Tangent and velocity; the limit of a function and limit laws.  (2.1-2.3.)

Week 4

Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivatives and rates of change.  (2.5-2.7.)

Week 5

Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)

Week 6

Chain rule and implicit differentiation.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)

Week 7

Rates and related rates.  (3.7-3.9.)

Week 8

Maximum and minimum values.  (3.10, 4.1.)

Week 9

Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.  (4.3-4.4.)

Week 10

Curve sketching; optimization problems.  (4.5-4.7.)

Week 11

Antiderivatives; areas and distance traveled.  (4.9, 5.1.)

Week 12

Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.  (5.2-5.3.)

Week 13

substitution rule.  (5.4-5.5.)
reviews.comment_teaching:
I give E to the instructor. the instructor does not know how to teach the class. She just reads the slide mechanically without useful explanation. (FYI, her English is not that good, which makes me sleepy) So actually I skipped half of the classes and do self-learning.
I will give A to the TA. the TA Wa Fai CHAN is quite good though. He will give you guidance step by step. But I think the tutorial is not necessary, too.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% for homework
75% for the final exam.
no record for attendance and no midterm

The grade is not released right now but I believe I will get A+ for this course. I took full marks for the homework (100%) and final exam (22/22). The exam questions are really easy, so don't worry about the exam (past paper may help)
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the workload is relatively low. Most of the workload comes from the homework (totally about 100 questions for homework).
The best way to learn this course is by skipping all the classes and learn all the things by yourself.
5 days are enough for self-learning all the stuff (If you are a mainland student, I recommend you do not spend too much time on this course, then following the schedule below is enough; I am not sure if it is also available for local student).
1) the first 2 days: read the textbook and the slides, do some notes
2) the second 2-day duration: finish all the questions on the tutorial materials
3) the fifth day: do some summaries and check your notes.

reviews.author: stress+tension
reviews.title: Boring lecture
reviews.comment_content:
Not that difficult. Mostly concepts from dse m2.
Topics include
Functions
limits
Differential calculus
And integral calculus
reviews.comment_teaching:
Avery ching is a boring lecturer. Relatively clear pronunciation, but spends a lot of time on boring, useless and irrelevant proofs of theorems. There are also very few examples in his lecture. Not worth attending. Skip the lectures and do something more meaningful

However, the tutorials offered by the TAs are quite good. Clear and concise explanation of questions which are like the actual exam.
reviews.comment_grading: Ok la
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. About one online assignment every 1-2 weeks. Assignments are not really difficult but they help with understanding (better than lectures)

Introduction of functions
limits
(provides a solid foundation for calculus)

differentiation (with applications: curve sketching, optimization)
integration (basics, integration by part & finding volume are in 1014)

Very Clear Handwriting
Explain slowly and clearly
Like to answer questions during lectures and by emails

Online Mode, so no mid-term

WebWork 25% (unlimited attempts and marks will not be deducted, so do not be scared to try)

Final 75%

light, just some assignments in WebWork (~10 questions per assignments)
Try to complete the questions in tutorials

reviews.author: dkdkdk
reviews.comment_content:
Calculus I
Mostly material from highschool calculus.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Some international students might find Avery Ching’s pronounciation hard to understand, but he is a nice professor.
But I can assure you many other professor’s pronounciation is much worse.
reviews.comment_grading:
I don’t have much to say because I got full marks for everything and got A+.
But my friends said they got a much higher grade than expected.
-Attendance not necessary for Avery.
reviews.comment_workload: Most material is from highschool calculus, although there is homework every two weeks, it is very manageable.

reviews.author: Patrick Hsieh
reviews.comment_content: It was the worst shit of my life. Even though it is a beginner's math class my friend told me there are many things they haven't learnt even in HL IB maths!
reviews.comment_teaching: His lectures are super boring. All he does is write theories and proves them but he never teaches how to solve certain questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Ok grading. I think you can pass with a 30% from what I've heard.
reviews.comment_workload: There is homework every week. About 5-15 questions. The homework is submitted online via webwork. There is an unlimited amount of trials to answer the questions.

reviews.author: 肯尼含
reviews.comment_content:
Simple calculus.

-Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  
-Elementary functions.  
-Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.
-Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative; rates of change.  
-Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.
-Chain rule and implicit differentiation.
-Rates and related rates.  
-Mean Value Theorem. Maximum and minimum values.
-Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.  
-Curve sketching; optimization problems.  
-Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled.  
-Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
-Net change; substitution rule.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor QIAN is a kind and nice professor.
He explained contents thoroughly and you can ask any question as you want.
Hand writing on the white board is neat and clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% online homework
30% midterm
50% final

Homework is easy and some of the questions will appear on the exam.
Reviewing all the questions before the exams is suggested.

Since midterm is the first exam in Math for the freshman, some people will not do it quite well. Never mind.
You can still get an A/A+ if you get a full mark on your final.

Final is REALLY easy, just relax.
reviews.comment_workload:
Sometimes i will forget to finish the homework online, but almost every freshman will have to take the course, so try to remind each other!

You can start to study the materials one week before the exam.
If you are not good at math..., well,  probably two weeks.

reviews.author: CyrusLung
reviews.title: Math 1012
reviews.comment_content: Teaching is bad, Grading is bad. If you are good at mathematics or have your M1/M2 dropped in secondary school time. It may be easier for you to catch up with the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: bullshit teaching, you can skip all the lectures, but remember not to skip the tutorial.

reviews.author: harrywn999
reviews.comment_content:
會教一D basic calculus for 冇m1m2底
有pre-calculus(sec,cosec,cot,absolute value,log/ln,etc..)limit, differentiation, dy/dx,graph sketching, integration各種技巧
可以算幾intensive同幾實用
功課佔15%
mid-term35%
final 50%
reviews.comment_teaching:
一星期有3堂lecture(當其中一堂同tutorial一樣性質), 1堂tutorial
lecture主要講理論同proof多, concept比較多,如果上lecture佢show example,exam會好大機會出,建議同學唔好一味抄note,先睇明同理解左先,如果唔係好難catch up到, Avery有時可能講得比較detail同悶, 但底差D既同學可以易D跟到
tutorial就主要教你點solve題目同比時間你做下,技巧性多D,同樣都係唔建議抄solution,最好明左個技巧就唔洗抄

但實際上exam題目,技巧唔洗好多,主要考個概念,千祈唔好睇少definition呢樣野(e.g what is a continuous function?)
reviews.comment_grading:
個grade就一般
Homework:100/100
mid-term:34/50 mean:21.2/50 (above mean 1.X sd)
final:82/100(寫錯id扣左3分變79) mean:42.35
Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload: workload完全唔大, webwork一星期一份到,一份10條題目到,可以用黎清concept,建議自己諗,自己做

reviews.author: jaychou
reviews.comment_content: 其實內容唔算好多 funciton 同一啲基本嘅calculus 好多都同dse嘅m2重覆 只有部份新嘢 好似fundamental theorem of calculus 基本上13weeks嘅堂cover晒dse大部份嘅calculus 但一啲advanced啲嘅concept就冇 例如integration by parts 只要有肯放時間落去睇同埋上網研究下 其實都ok
reviews.comment_teaching: avery雖然講嘢都有高低起伏 但lecture講嘅嘢太theoretical 好多都喺proof番啲theorem 如果唔喺有心想major math 或者淨喺想要grade 建議上zeta嘅tutor就夠 佢會另外派note 上堂主要教做數 有啲似dse嗰種exam-oriented式嘅做法 但絕對有助於你攞好grade 不過講嘢把聲就有啲悶 同埋偏細聲 建議煲lecture video就算
reviews.comment_grading: 如果你有m2底呢個絕對喺靚grade course 你未必喺top嗰堆 但一定唔會喺最後 因為之後實在有太多冇calculus底嘅人逼住要讀1012嚟送死
reviews.comment_workload: workload 唔大 得一個mt同final 如果keep住有做下數閒白下佢講咩其實好輕鬆

reviews.author: Jimmy Mo
reviews.comment_content:
Straight forward. M2 things and new rules.
notes same for every year. Refer to sources if you want to study beforehand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Detailed explanation. English good enough for a maths professor.
suggest ppl without M1/M2 background to attend tutorials or watch video for tutorials.

********there are no videos for lectures********only tutorials are taped.
reviews.comment_grading:
Had a bit of M2 background. (dropped after learning integration)
Did not do much exercise.
Started revising for mid term 3 days before, and final.4-5 days.

midterm above 1.3 SD
final (mean changes from year to year) : unknown mean and SD

reviews.comment_workload: 10 webworks in total. Do pay attention to deadlines. Had missed one web work ******there was one webwork which its deadline was right after midterm.

reviews.author: nora
reviews.comment_content: Lecture not very useful but tutor is very good. Especially Zeta. Although he sometimes will have a bad mood. Mainly limit, differentiation and integration.
reviews.comment_teaching: He will keep on write different notes in the lecture and try to teach you how to do the question by theory. Mainly theory and he will seldom teach how to do a question. Therefore, I don't really think his teaching is good.
reviews.comment_grading: Mid term and final are hard. Therefore you must complete webwork!! It is because webwork counts for 15% of the mark!
reviews.comment_workload:
For the whole semester, need to do a total of 9 webwork.
Each webwork will have more than a week for you to complete. So the workload is still ok if you can manage your time well.

reviews.author: kattsang
reviews.comment_content: The contest is similar to what you have learnt in M1 and M2 in dse level. People without any background in M1 and M2 may find it difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is boring. In lecture, all he talks about is proof and teaches nothing about solving maths problems. Tutorials are more useful because the tutor gives you exercises to do.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade ok
People who dropped M1 and M2 can easily get grade A.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is not much workload.
You have to complete webwork almost every week. You can submit webwork many times until you get it all correct.

reviews.author: Gman
reviews.comment_content: The content is mainly Calculus  I. If you studied it before, you shouldn't really face too much of a problem.
reviews.comment_teaching:
It felt like at times attending the lectures didn't really help out all that much as it made things a little more confusing than it really needed to be.

The tutorial on the other hand was more informative and even though it was supposed to serve as recap of what we learnt, it was much easier understanding the concepts in the tutorials than in the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Even scoring the mean will only land you a C.
Their way of marking the midterm and exams is very specific:  if you do not follow/show some specific steps to obtain the final answer, you'll only get a third of the overall mark for the question even if the answer is correct.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is quite average and manageable. There is Webwork due each week along with a 'quiz'. However, these are not enough to get you a good grade in the mid-term and final and so needless to say, you need to practice a lot on own your own.

Webwork 25 + Final 75
VERY bad grading and if you are not good in the final exam, you fail. It is like gambling.
This course REALLY sucks and UST is just trying to torture the students without any M2 backgrounds.
reviews.comment_workload: Very tough to clear concepts of the whole M2 + some DLCs topics within 3 months.

reviews.author: twothree
reviews.title: Math 1012: 體驗三個月內學完高中三年M2
reviews.comment_content:
Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.
Elementary functions.
Tangent and velocity; the limit of a function and limit laws.
Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivatives and rates of change.
Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.
Chain rule and implicit differentiation
Rates and related rates
Maximum and minimum values
Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule
Curve sketching, optimization problems
Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled
Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
Net change; substitution rule
reviews.comment_teaching:
Avery is a nice guy but doesn't know how to teach.

The lecture he made was is just showing the proof of every equation. Not very useful in clearing the concept or is any practical.

The English Avery spoke was remarkably horrible.

The TA is kind and patient. Please revise her note which is very useful if you don't want to fail. Highly recommended to attend her lecture, though her English is with some accent but is very clear.

Phyllis's website: https://masxliang.people.ust.hk/

Walter Chan's website:https://sites.google.com/view/walterchan

No attendance thus recommended skipping Avery's lecture to save time.
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork (25%)
Final Exam (75%)

All questions in the final exam are MCQ.
The exam questions are way harder than the notes.

I didn't study M2 in highschool thus haven't learned calculus before. This course is extremely tough for me.

I am extremely unfortunate, all the questions I randomly chose were wrong, but somehow got a B.

This course is utterly unpleasant, never want to attend this course again.
reviews.comment_workload:
Webwork is the only online homework.

Difficult and time-consuming.

But you can submit the answer for infinite times before the deadline.

Please make sure you have all the question in the webwork correct, 100% in webwork is a lifesaver.

WolframAlpha is very useful, don't be afraid to use it.
https://www.wolframalpha.com/

Math 1012 with Avery as the instructor is basically semi self-teach, it takes much time to learn a new concept.

reviews.author: honestreview
reviews.title: easy, uninformative, and a bit disappointing
reviews.comment_content: As the most basic and important course for a university student, this course failed to equipped students with enough knowledge about Calculus. Compared to nearby Asian universities and Ivy League universities, this course is amazingly uninformative. To be honest, the 2 week pre-Calculus course I took in the summer at my home country covers more subjects and depth of Calculus than this course. Even Math 1013 is not enough(I took a look at their final exam papers)
reviews.comment_teaching: the professor is very nice. But someone may complained about his accent and he liked to say "ummmm" from time to time.
reviews.comment_grading: Very good. Since the mean is only about half of the full mark.
reviews.comment_workload: one Webwork assignment per week. Considering the difficulty and number of problems, you only need to spend about 1-2 hours on each.

reviews.author: Sakamoto
reviews.title: Well, quite easy.
reviews.comment_content: Compared with 1013, the theorems are mostly covered but the proof is always skipped or just tricky ones. I was enrolled in this class by mistake(kind of) and I have some calculus background so I think it's too easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is very responsible, and the TA in my tutorial is very enthusiastic. I think they are great.
reviews.comment_grading: Well, as I said in the "Content" column, I can't judge the grading because I've already learnt most of the knowledge. But one of my friends who enrolled in this class(with no doubt) got an A+. So I think the grading is quite good.
reviews.comment_workload: Well, the same webwork as 1013, so it might be a little bit hard for students enrolled in this class. The tests are just easy, so no much workload.

reviews.author: aishuj
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  (1.2-1.3; Appendix A.)
Week 2 Elementary functions.  (1.5-1.6; Appendix B-D.)
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.  (2.1-2.3.)
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.  (2.5-2.7.)
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)
Week 6 Chain rule and implicit differentiation.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)
Week 7 Rates and related rates.  (3.7-3.9.)
Week 8 Linear approximation and differentials; Maximum and minimum values.  (3.10, 4.1.)
Week 9 Derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.  (4.3-4.4.)
Week 10 Curve sketching; optimization problems.  (4.5-4.7.)
Week 11 Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled.  (4.9, 5.1.)
Week 12 Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.  (5.2-5.3.)
Week 13 Net change; substitution rule.  (5.4-5.5.)
reviews.comment_teaching: You surely will not understand his accent. Which makes the lectures completely useless as I had a tough time just understanding what he was trying to say. E.g He will use phrases that make no sense. "your naive brains" "it is a mind-game". But he is dedicated to his work and puts in a lot of effort by writing out the notes all over the board. But you will spend time just copying down those notes and not understanding anything taught.
reviews.comment_grading: They are harsh. That's it. Even if your answer is right you can be marked down if they don't like the way you solved it.
reviews.comment_workload: It is a 4 credit course so it is really heavy on work. There are lectures, tutorials, and webwork. There is webwork almost every week, but completely useless because the exam is nothing like the questions from it.

reviews.comment_teaching:
I've literally paid 0 attention to lectures and attended 1 session of tutorial.Dr. Yang did say he won't be teaching us but could only provide examples on the very first lecture so I'll give him credits for being honest.

Instead I've used online materials to help me understand the concepts of calculus, Phyllis did give us notes on all topics which is quite useful. Unfortunately, I can't say her teaching really helped me.

Here's some of the materials I've used to learn Calculus:
Professor Leonard: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fYyARMqiaag&list=PLF797E961509B4EB5 (For clearing concepts)
Oscar Cheung: https://www.youtube.com/@oscarcheung718/featured (For question samples)
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is meh.
Grading scheme 1: Homework 20%; Mid-term 30%; Final 50%.
Grading scheme 2: Homework 20%; Mid-term 10%; Final 70%.
Homework average: 87.2/100; My score:100/100.
Mid-term average: 28.47/100; My score: 22/100.
Final average: 59.95/100; My score: 76/100.
My overall mark under scheme 1: 64.6/100.
My overall mark under scheme 2: 75.4/100.
Grade: B

Mid-term contents: Limits, Derivatives, Implicit differentiation.
Final exam contents: Limits, Optimization, L'Hoptial's rule, Curve sketching
reviews.comment_workload:
2-3 Homework per month, 16 questions on average.
Questions could be difficult for someone who haven't touched calculus at all, but most of the solutions can be found online. Feel free to ask your lecturers questions on homework you don't understand, they even give you answers sometimes lol.

Easy calculus and secondary school math

reviews.comment_teaching: Clear and easy to understand
reviews.comment_grading:
25% webwork
and 75% final exam
Review it as early as possible because quite a lot of thing to review
reviews.comment_workload: Only weborks, you can try unlimited times until you get the correct answer.

reviews.author: michaelau999
reviews.title: A good grade course if you hold TA tightly
reviews.comment_content:
Same as the first half calculus in DSE M1 and M2

functions
limits
derivatives
application of derivatives
integrations

The content is useful
reviews.comment_teaching:
For Avery, since the course is really rush, he does not have time to explain or prove the law. However, it does not matter if you do not know how calculus comes from as the course does not request us how to prove the formulas in examination and homework. What you need to know is how to use different formulas to solve the question. That's it.  

For Phyllis, my TA. She is gorgeous, helpful and patient. Her tutorial note include a bunch of exercises captured from past exam papers. She explains every question in detail. Even though you do not what Avery is talking about, Phyllis can save your grade. I strongly recommend people who do not study calculus previously
attend her tutorial or watch all her videos at least. It would be really helpful.

If have questions with your homework, I suggest you ask phyllis in person or via zoom, because Avery is too smart, he does not why we cannot understand and Phyllis does not reply email frequently.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite good I think and fair.
no mid term

25 % webwork
(you should get all these mark, you can find the answer on google or ask TA)

75 % final exam
(open book, 19 MC out of 22 mark, only 2 of them are really hard, the other is not that hard)

My final grade, 25/25 webwork , 19/22 in final, I got  A  luckily.

I think it is pretty fair for students do not study M1 or M2 in DSE.
Avery is not a killer in my opinion.
reviews.comment_workload:
Medium

webwork every week and one final.

It is good to spend sometime to review and do all past papers

reviews.author: Brandon Shi
reviews.comment_content:
这是一门单变量微积分入门课程，是微积分 I 和 II 序列中的第一门课程，专为未修读 HKDSE 数学扩展模块 M1 或 M2 的学生而设计。主题包括函数及其极限、连续性、导数和微分规则、导数的应用和基本积分。

是的，正确，但我认为这不仅仅是基本的。作为一个没接触过微积分的学生，已经很辛苦了。（此外，我的数学很弱。:( )

期中之前还算可以接受，期中只包括一些基本的微分和三角恒等式，（但是双角公式对我来说太难了。）但是一旦你到了期末考试，那就是另一回事了。为了准备期末考试，我至少花了整整 2 周的时间，通过完成教程给出的练习来很好地处理集成问题。当我试图做期末试卷时，我根本不知道如何做第一道长题！给出的期末考试过去的试卷非常难，无法完成长题部分。虽然期末考试因为疫情原因是开卷全选择题，难度有所降低，但对于微积分新手来说还是很有挑战性的。

这些讲座通过简单的例子教你微积分的基本理论。虽然教程为您提供了更适度的练习。这样你就可以从他们那里赢得一些信任。考试来了，他们给你的问题和你以前做过的100%不同，让你不知道如何解决它们，让你之前建立的信心崩溃，你的成绩也被打破了。
reviews.comment_teaching:
林先生善于教学，我有幸得到他的教导。通过他的解释很容易理解这个理论。他会在课堂上解决一些网络问题，这很好。唯一的问题是与考试级别相比，课堂上教授的问题太简单了。如果你只用他的笔记准备期末考试，你会发现很难。

与我做过的其他导师的笔记相比，陈先生的辅导笔记很有用，帮助我克服了很多基本问题。尽管如此，在应对考试方面问题类型还不够丰富。

小伙伴们一直抱怨Avery教我的，但我没受过他的教，不好评论。也许你可以自己尝试他的教学（或者看其他评论就足够了）。:)

值得指出的是，我只参加了前 3 个教程，然后我跳过了所有教程，因为我觉得如果你完成了笔记中的所有练习，差别并不大。虽然我参加了前 7 个讲座，因为我觉得还好，没有浪费我的时间。但是对于剩下的13堂课（11月之后不包括7堂视频课），我觉得我有更有意义的事情（比如打麻将和学习麻将）而不是去听。

TL:DR，不要把时间浪费在你不感兴趣的事情上，也不能显着改善你的结果。只是跳过它们都对你的考试来说仍然很好（因为你仍然没有在考试中取得好成绩）。
reviews.comment_grading:
如果你擅长数学，那么这门课程很适合你。我相信拿A对天才来说并不难。尽管如此，付出更多努力以确保您获得足够高的分数。

如果你像我一样数学不好（DSE 数学 3~4 级），你最好准备好获得 C 或 B - 即使你做了很多练习，包括来自互联网的资源，你只是没有足够的天赋来克服问题有时。
reviews.comment_workload:
9 个困难的网络作业
1 个具有挑战性和失去信心的期中
考试 1 个超级难，非人类做的（除了这个研讨会）期末考试
就是这样。

没有太多的工作要做，除了工作，学习，复习整整两周不玩任何游戏（包括麻将！！）。

Webworks要全部做完满分，因为你有无限的尝试，否则你会很难考试（题型有点相似，值得做）。
但我认为对于那些数学成绩好的人来说很好，因为他们对如何回答这些问题有清晰的思路，所以他们不需要做很多工作来提高自己，我相信。（没有冒犯的意思）

reviews.author: Kabul
reviews.title: Do past paper
reviews.comment_content:
This is my first as well as my last MATH course to be taken in UST. It's basically M2 stuff with a few additional theorems like the mean-value theorem and L'hôpital rule. For those who have not taken M2 it could be a little bit hard to follow, so make sure don't skip any lectures, no matter how useless you think they are. Tutorials are good opportunities to have some practice and ask more "technical" questions, and before coming to the tutorials it's necessary to clarify the concepts in lectures first.

Topics include:
♦ Functions and their graphs;
♦ Trigonometric functions, exponential and log functions and their inverses;
♥ Limits, asymptotes of graphs, continuity;
♥ Derivatives of elementary functions, product and quotient rules, chain rule.
♥ Implicit differentiations.
♥ Rate of changes.
♠ Extrema of functions. The mean value theorem.
♥ Increasing and Decreasing functions. Curve sketching.
Optimizations.
♠ L'hôpital rule.
♠ Riemann sums and definite integrals. The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
♥ Integration by Substitution.

♦ DSE Maths Compulsory Parts
♥ DSE Maths Extended M2 Parts
♠ New Topics
reviews.comment_teaching:
CHING, Avery is a very clear-minded and logical professor, and he is able to present the basic concepts very well. However, he focuses mainly on the "philosophy" of maths rather than the "technical" aspects of how to solve mathematical problems. Sometimes he just confuses us even more as he gets more in depth in his own philosophy. If you can't catch up make sure you go to the Maths Support Center and don't be afraid to raise questions.

CHAN, Yun Hung (TA), on the other way round, focuses on solving problems more than introducing and explaining concepts. He has a very bad Hong Kong accent, and many international students complained that they didn't understand. However it should be understandable for the locals. As time is limited he often teaches VERY fast in the lectures. Make sure you really take out a piece of paper and a pen to have a try solving the problem, but not just sit there looking as he writes. Practice determines your grade.
reviews.comment_grading:
💻 15%: WebWork
✏️ 35%: Midterms
✏️ 50%: Finals

Relative grading:
-1 SD: ~C-
Mean: ~C+
+1 SD: ~B+
> +1.1 SD: ~A range

However, it still depends on the professor, so...

Make sure you do all the WebWork and try to score full marks in every assignment. Full marks are expected for almost all students and if you fail to do so you will be at a huge disadvantage.

The midterm was quite easy, and shouldn't be a problem for those who had paid SOME effort in maths.
Mean: 26.68/50, SD: 13.45
My score: 50/50 (1.73 SD above mean)

The final was much harder and it tested on whether we had clear concepts and could present it in a logical manner. Any minor logical flaws can have your marks deducted, even if you have arrived at the right answer.
Mean: 48.64/100, SD: 22.61
My score: 99/100 (2.23 SD above mean)

Overall score: 99.5%
Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload in this course is the fortnightly WeBwork.
There are 9 of them, and they constitute 15% of your final grade. The WeBwork is quite challenging and asks tricky questions, so it costs a considerable amount of time to finish. Try to score full marks as it allows unlimited attempts.

reviews.author: tianyu
reviews.title: simple calculus
reviews.comment_content:
Simple one-variable calculus. There are four parts:
Limit
Derivative
Antiderivative
integration
Remember their definition and you are going to get an A.
reviews.comment_teaching: N/A. I didn't attend any tutorials or lectures. But my prof would upload all lecture notes to the canvas- including all concepts you should learn - for you to revise. The notes are thorough so I still give a B.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 schemes :
///Hw:20% Mt:30% Final:50% ///
///Hw:20% Mt:10% Final:70% ///
Probably because the mean of the midterm is too low.

///Hw mean:18.32/20 me:20/20
///Mt mean:30.68/100 me:96/100
///Final mean:56.91 me:99/100
///overall mean:60.82 me:98.9
letter grade A+ not surprised.

Although the mean is very low, the exam is pretty easy.
The midterm duration is 2 hours and I left 1 hour earlier; I made a careless mistake on the step so only 96.
The Final duration is 3 hours and I finished the paper within one hour; many people left when the TA allowed us to leave.
This year the final does not include integrations;
here's a tip: learn the Lhosipital rule, mean value thm, and also Tylor expansion. You can KO all the limit questions in a few seconds.
reviews.comment_workload: only 8 hw; each of them takes one hour to finish. Consider that each hw gives you two weeks, the workload is low.

reviews.author: Mariooooo
reviews.title: We learn nothing but get A+
reviews.comment_content: the worth class I have ever taken. I learn nothing. everything in MATH1012 I have learned in my high school. it just likes a gift, a FREE A+.make me feel the comfort from school.
reviews.comment_teaching: the accent was terrible. I can't stand that and I can't understand it either. honestly I have never go to the class except the first and the last class.
reviews.comment_grading:
A+
The only reason I took this class.
reviews.comment_workload:
zero
just write some sample papers before the exam. By the way, there is no sample paper for MATH1012. I got them from MATH1013

reviews.author: reosaki
reviews.comment_content:
The class just covers the basic curriculum in mainland's high school.

The homework is too boring.

大陆高考生出门右转选择1023/1024吧，即使是pre-reg了1012和1013也一定要swap掉。
上这门课简直是在浪费生命……
reviews.comment_teaching:
Avery is a good teacher who always tries to explain the concepts as clearly as possible. He delivers a good presentation with logical thinking.

For me the only thing to criticise is that his teaches this class.
reviews.comment_grading: Though it's the beginning of the semester I firmly believe that I'll get an A.
reviews.comment_workload: It's pretty considerate that you don't need to attended the lecture or tutorial either.
